loans.name: Hiyasmin

texts.en:
Hiyasmin, 43 years old, is married and has two children. She experienced work in a private company for eight years but her salary was not enough to sustain the needs of her family. That's why she decided to resign and focus on her business together with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 48,000 to purchase fish for her business. Hiyasmin is a very hardworking person who works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She is the one who checks on all the needs of her business. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Cúc

texts.en:
Mrs. Cúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Cúc has been involved in this business for four years.

Cúc is 36 years old, and she is married with two children. Cúc lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Cúc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Cúc faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Cúc hopes to maintain a successful business, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Narangerel, 41 years old, lives with her only son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband died in a road accident in 2002. 

She has been selling grindstones to building companies for many years. She is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to buy grindstones at a wholesale price so that she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. This business is the only income source for her family. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to open great opportunities for her son.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of grindstones

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham used his prior loan to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His loan helped not just in his business but also in the education of his children. His income from the business is assisting with their everyday household  expenditures. He works hard to provide for their everyday needs. He also has a direct selling and electronic loading station for additional income.

Abraham requested another loan for 22,000 PHP, which he will use loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in his business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will help him to sustain his family's daily needs. 

Abraham hopes to be more successful in his business and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and in these meetings he can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise products

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 40 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Esperanza works very hard to provide for her family.

Esperanza's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Esperanza has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Esperanza has taken a PHP 9,450 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Esperanza is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou works hard to support her family. Jackielou has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, etc.

Jackielou has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Jackielou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 56 years old and a widow with one child. Marietta works very hard to provide for the family.

Marietta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marietta has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 54 years old and married with five children.

Perla is in agricultural businesses, raising pigs and farming rice in the Philippines. Perla requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Perla has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine.

Maria has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fely works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Fely is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig-fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth previously accessed a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jenneth dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Alma is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy cloth and other dressmaking materials for her business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other dressmaking materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 40 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 19 years. She earns additional income from selling rice.

Rosalinda requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc., to sell.  Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. Judith is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Judith has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is thankful for the financial support extended to her. She was able to buy more of the ingredients needed in her ice scramble business and she is able to help her family financially. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She continues to work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy ingredients of "ice scramble" such as ice, different candies, and chocolate. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Michelle dreams to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients of "ice scramble" such as ice, different candies, and chocolate.

loans.name: Roberto Ivan

texts.es: Roberto tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Roberto posee un puesto en el mercado de su localidad en cual comercializa variedad de artículos como: cereales, carne de pollo, bebidas, especies, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho tiempo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el negocio como: pollo, cereales, especies, bebidas y de más artículos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Roberto is 25 year old and lives in his own house along with his family group. Roberto has a stand in the local market where he sells a variety of articles like cereals, chicken, spices, drinks, etc. He makes his living in this way and supports his household. This business is his main source of income so he wants to keep it active for a long time. So he has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business like cereals, chicken spices, drinks and other items requested by his clients.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cereals, spices, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Helen is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc., for her general store business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Cesi

texts.es:
La Sra. Cesi tiene 49 años de edad, tiene una despensa desde hace 14 años, donde trabaja arduamente para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha y se esfuerza por poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de artículos varios para agrandar más su stock de productos para la venta, como ser bebidas, lácteos, verduras, frutas y ropas y calzados, ya que tiene anexo a su despensa la venta de ropas y calzados.
Agradece  a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en: Cesi is 49 years old. She has had a store for 14 years where she works hard to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is very hard-working and strives and makes the effort to continue growing as she has been doing. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of articles to increase her stock of products for sale like drinks, dairy products, vegetables, fruit, clothing and footwear as she sells clothing and footwear next to her store. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques les sept  femmes du groupe Benkadi. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de kalaban-coro chef-lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de kalaban-coro. Les membres du groupe font tous les petits commerces de, poissons. Dans le dessein de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bassitan (femme assise devant sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du  poisson de toutes les variétés. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400kg de poisson frais à Kabala au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché  et en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. Madame Bassitan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi group are married women mainly living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 44 years of age, with six children. They all live in the Kalaban-Coro village, the center of their community in the Kati district (in the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors as well as through their work at the market of Kalaban-Coro. The group members work as vendors selling fish. With the goal of replenish their stock for cash, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their four solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Bassitan (the one seated in front in the photo) is a well-known vendor selling all kinds of fish. She plans to use her loan to buy 400 kg [882 lbs] of fresh fish in Kabala, along the Niger river. She sells for cash and on credit, at the market as well as a street vendor, to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Bassitan hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 125,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvested in her business and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 56 años de edad y habita junto a sus dos hermanos de 60 y 64 años de edad en casa propia. Andrea se dedica al cultivo y venta de variedad y hermosas plantas ornamentales. El negocio lo tiene desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía del hogar. Este negocio es muy importante por lo que ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio en esta ocasión desea comprar árboles frutales para ofrecer nuevos productos a los clientes y poder así incrementar su ventas e ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Andrea is 56 years old and lives with two of her siblings aged 60 and 64 in their own home. Andrea grows and sells a variety of beautiful ornamental plants. She has had the business for many years now and it is how she makes a living and supports the household. This business is very important so she has taken the decision to invest in it at this time by buying fruit trees to offer new items for her clients. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and profits which would permit her to improve her's and her family's living conditions

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit trees for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Luz is 50 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Luz has a general store business in the Philippines and she requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, eggs, sugar, etc.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an egg retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Lucia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old, single, and helps her parents to generate income for the family.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like noodles, sugar, and coffee.

Mercy has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. Mary Grace is married and has a direct-selling Avon and personal collection products business in the Philippines.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more Avon and personal collection products to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 12 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Mary Grace would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more Avon and personal collection products to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Susan has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
This is Jimmy, 35, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Flory, a housewife, and they have children. Together, they manage their household, while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jimmy operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials, like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. 

Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories and others of the like. JImmy's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Jimmy is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan to buy recyclable materials needed in his business.

Jimmy dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jeaneth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal-retailing and fruit-vending. Jeaneth is borrowing PHP 26,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell through her general store business.

Jeaneth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jyothi Enterprise

texts.en: Jyothi Enterprise is a village based organization that promotes health and solar lighting products promotion. Mr Nagaraj is the proprietor of Jyothi Enterprise. They select Women Village Level Entrepreneurs from the 100 Self Help Groups and provide earning opportunities by selling solar products. Jyothi Enterprise operates from Karantaka where 1.3 million people are using kerosene lamps for their basic lighting needs. The area of Karnataka where they work has only 60% electrification. Solar lighting will help children to study, mobile charging and small shop owners.  Some of the areas in which Jyothi Enterprise has a presence are not connected by grid electricity. In order to ensure clean lighting solutions and to provide earning opportunities, Jyothi Enterprise is seeking a loan to help scale up their impact.

loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power Solar Lighting Products

loans.name: Florabel

texts.en: Florabel is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, Florabel requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Florabel has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: María Patricia

texts.es: María es una mujer que toda la vida ha buscado la ingeniosa manera de poder generar un ingreso en su casa, para ellos aprovecha un negocio de un familiar el cual es la distribución de mercancía específicamente el trigo, ya que tienen un negocio que es muy conocido en su municipio, pero María no quería vivir a costa de los logros hechos por su familia quería tener un establecimiento donde ella fuera la administradora y se sintiera orgullosa de generar ingresos con sus propias actitudes de emprendedora y negociante. Para lograr estos objetivos monto una puesto de venta de productos elaborados con trigo, solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía como galletas, panes, tostadas, palitos y unos dulces que quiere empezar a vender en su negocio con el sueño de llegar a ser la distribuidora más reconocida del municipio, un negocio tan rentable con el que pueda pensar en montar una casa propia, y cumplir diferentes sueños que tiene toda persona como adquirir un vehículo y poder tener las mejores condiciones de ida para su hijo de 6 años de edad el cual ha criado sola ya que es una madre cabeza de hogar
texts.en:
María is a woman who has searched all her life for a smart way to generate income for her family. So she has taken advantage of the family business of distributing wheat. It is a well known business in her municipality. But María did not want to live at the expense of the gains made by her family. She wanted to start a business where she was the manager and could feel proud of generating revenue with her own entrepreneurial and business acumen.

To achieve these objectives she opened a business selling products made from wheat. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like biscuits, breads, toast, bread sticks and some sweets that she wants to sell in her business with the dream of becoming the best known distributor in her municipality. She hopes to have a business that is so profitable that she can think about building her own house and fulfill various dreams that she has: like buying a vehicle and having better living conditions for her 6 year old son who she has raised by herself as the head of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock (breads, biscuits, toast and sweets).

loans.name: Felda Marie

texts.en:
Felda Marie is married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Felda Marie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish net and other materials needed for fishing.

Felda Marie has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other materials needed for fishing.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 50 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Mildred is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mildred has been in pig-fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anchita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Anchita works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling bamboo. Anchita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Anchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to allow her to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en: Flordeliz is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional duck eggs to sell. Flordeliz has been in this business for two years. Flordeliz earns additional income from fish vending. Flordeliz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 36 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosario is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosario has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Adela

texts.es: Carmen una joven soltera que se asoció junto con una amiga con la que estudio para montar más que un trabajo una bella labor, un proyecto tan desinteresado que toca el corazón de cualquier persona y es que Carmen decidió entregar los mejores años de su vida al servicio de las personas y no son cualquier tipo de personas son las personas de avanzadas edad, estos abuelos que en muchas ocasiones son descuidados por sus familias dejándolos a un lado como si ya no cumplieran una función. Carmen culmino sus estudios referentes al cuidado de estas personas y trabajo como auxiliar donde perfecciono sus cuidados, atenciones a estas personas, su idea de negocio se desarrollo junto con una amiga de clase y de prácticas, juntando ahorros y montando un centro gerontológico. Solicita un crédito para mejorar el local puesto que la seccional de salud una entidad reguladora le está exigiendo como acondicionar barras de apoyo, cerrar el patio, la cocina y acondicionar un cuarto de basuras, con los que esperar seguir sirviendo a estos abuelos tan queridos para ellas
texts.en:
Carmen is a young single woman who along with a friend she studied with decided to open what is more than a job, a beautiful thing. It is such an unselfish project that would touch the heart of anyone. Carmen has decided to give the best years of her life to serve others. Not just anybody, but seniors. Those grandparents who many times are poorly cared for by their families putting them aside as they no longer serve a function.

Carmen finished her studies about the care of the elderly and worked as an assistant to perfect her care and attention to these people. The idea of a business developed with a friend from her courses and practicum pooling their saving and opening a geriatric center.

She is requesting a loan to improve the premises as the local health authority has requested them to install support bars, fence in the patio and the kitchen and upgrade the garbage room so they can continue to serve these old people they love so much.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business as required by the local health authorities.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 54, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a vendor, and is a mother of her children. Nenita and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

In order to help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nenita dreams of expanding her business and giving her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration by studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture, farming food.

Hà is 46 years old and she is married, with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hà joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid three loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. 

Hà has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet, bathroom, and water filter system.

In the future, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet, bathroom, and water filter system.

loans.name: Đạo

texts.en:
Mrs. Đạo operates a food stall/restaurant, selling vegetables.

Đạo is 59 years old and she is married, with three children. She lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đạo's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Đạo faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. 

Dao is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Đạo hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 49 years old and married, with three children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell, like eggs, sugar, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, and fabric conditioner.

Raquel has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Raquel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like eggs, sugar, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, and fabric conditioner.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married and she works hard to support her family. She sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. 

Merlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Loudesita

texts.en:
Loudesita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a coconut wine-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Loudesita has been in this business for 28 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and she works hard to support her family. She sells vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Irene is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es un grupo nuevo formado en la ciudad de Luque, la mayoría de estas mujeres son amas de casa que quieren emprender una actividad, todo esto para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda quien ha hecho la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y quien en su primera encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que está mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Ella quiere poder emprender en el viejo negocio de su mama, que tuvo que cerrar ya que no tenían suficientes ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, fideos, arroz, yerba, y demás productos, que les permitirá empezar a trabajar y luchar por un nuevo futuro.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario is a new group in the city of Luque. Most of these women are housewives who want to undertake a business to be able to help out their families through their work. 

One of the members is Zunilda, who has done the poverty elimination survey. She had a poverty level of 3 in her first survey, which shows that she is improving through her efforts and continuous work. She wants to be able to start up her mother's old business, which had to close because it didn't produce enough income. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, pasta, rice, yerba mate, and other products, which will help her to be able to begin to work and to fight for a better future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, pasta, rice, yerba mate, and other products.

loans.name: Zully

texts.es:
La Sra. Zully tiene 43 años de edad, es casada tiene tres hijos, todos ya mayores.
Comenta que ella  empezó trabajando desde muy joven con su tía de quien aprendió el oficio de modista, ella hoy confecciona prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, luego de mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda del esposo logro adquirir tres máquinas e independizarse.
Actualmente ya  trabaja en su casa y ha podido criar y dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitaron en su momento.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, entre otros, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zully is 43 years old, married, and has three, grown-up children. She says that she began working with her aunt from a very young age, who taught her the dressmaking trade. Today, she makes women's, men's and children's clothing. After a great deal of effort and with the help of her husband she managed to acquire three machines and become independent. Nowadays, she works from home and has been able to raise her children and give them everything they needed.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying fabrics, threads, bands, buttons and other items. This will enable her to keep working and meeting her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, bands, buttons and other items.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, todas ellas son mujeres madres de familia, cuyo único propósito es poder trabajar y que cada una ayude a sus seres queridos por medio de ese trabajo.
Hermelinda es una de las integrantes, quien también es la presidenta de este grupo, comenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a seguir luchando por los objetivos de cada una. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. También comenta que a través de este sacrificado trabajo ayuda a su familia y lucha por darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Hoy Hermelinda pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y demás, que le permitirá seguir haciendo las comidas, y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eighteen women make up this group, They are all mothers, whose sole aim is to be able to work and help her loved ones through this work.

Hermelinda is one of the members, and is also the group president. She says that she always tries to motivate her colleagues to continue fighting for their goals. She is a very enterprising woman, who works selling food that she cooks, and then goes out to sell on the street. She also says that through this hard work she helps her family and fights to give them everything she never had.

Today, Hermelinda is requesting this loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, baked goods and other items, which will enable her to continue making food and fighting as she always has done.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Nhiều

texts.en:
Nhiều works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Nhiều is 51 years old and she is married, with five children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhiều's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Nhiều has been involved in this business for more than ten years.
The main hardship that Nhiều faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and water tank.

With her business profit, Nhiều hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet and water tank.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines.

She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy pandan leaves, dye, etc. for her business.

Lilia has been in this business for thirteen years.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pandan leaves, dye, etc. for her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 49 years old and married, with four children, two of whom are in school. Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase soft drinks, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Marichu has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and she works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pottery. Lolita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a business selling beer and soft drinks in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional cases of soft drinks and beer to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft-drinks and beers to sell

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan is a 44-years old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been manufacturing the plastic bottles through an injection molding machine for many years. He buys plastic bottles from market and put them into the injection machine. The plastic bottles melt under high temperature and then are injected into the dies through compression to give the raw material shape. In this way he manufactures plastic bottles, then sells them in the market and makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood. 

He has seven children and he barely manages to satisfy their needs. He is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. He needs to earn additional income to support his family well. He is in his repeat loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently he has requested a loan to buy more plastic bottles for manufacturing so that he can increase his sale. He expects a boost in his earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of his business. Ramzan is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic bottles material for crushing into raw material

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Huệ is 56 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  She operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat.

She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 44 years old and married, with eight children. With two children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, (NWTF) to purchase more nipa to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Shiela works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling herbal products. Shiela is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell for her ready-to-wear vending business.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Sarminia's Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Lorenzo está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eulalia quien se encuentra mejorando su situación económica, a través del esfuerzo que viene haciendo en la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de poder capacitarse para implementar todo lo que aprenda en su emprendimiento. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, y calzados varios, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas y ofreciendo una mejor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Lorenzo group is on its fourth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, which has Eulalia as one of its members. Eulalia is improving her financial situation through her own efforts selling all sorts of items as a street vendor.

Eulalia is very hard-working and, more than that, has a great desire to do more training and put what she learns into her business. Eulalia is applying for this loan in order to buy clothes and footwear. With these items she can continue to make her sales and offer a greater variety of goods to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio es una persona de edad mayor, que pese a su edad no se deja vencer y sigue trabajando y luchando, ya que se siente aun con muchas ganas y vitalidad de seguir haciéndolo. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar ladrillos para poder trabajar y ayudar a su familia.
Hoy quiere otro préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de mas ladrillos, para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando como lo viene haciendo. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Eligio is an older man who, in spite of his age, does not allow himself to be defeated. He continues working and fighting, and still has a great desire and vitality to keep on going. Eligio tells us that he used his previous loan to buy bricks, in order to work and help his family.

Today he is applying for another loan in order to buy more bricks and continue with his work. He will continue to fight as before. Eligio is grateful for this new opportunity that will allow him to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy bricks to sell.

loans.name: Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Trabajadoras 2 está integrado por 15 mujeres, donde todas tienen la intención de capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la costura, comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo se ha ido mejorando. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y a sus seres queridos, tiene la meta de poder tener un taller grande donde pueda también dar trabajo a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos, tela, gomas, botones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en: This group called "Trabajadoras 2" (Working Women 2) is formed by 15 women, whose goals are getting trained and improving their quality of life. One of the outstanding members is Maria, who works in sewing. She says that she has many regular customers, whose number, thanks to her hard work and effort, has been increasing. She is a woman devoted to her family and her loved ones. She has the goal of opening a big workshop which can give jobs to other people. She is requesting this loan to buy threads, elastic bands, buttons and others, and in this way continue doing her job.

loans.use: To buy threads, fabric, elastic bands, buttons and others.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal tiene 33 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Itá. Es de profesión cerrajero, es dueño de 3 cerrajerías, ubicadas en diferentes  partes del mercado.
Comenta que con mucho sacrificio se ha abierto camino y que tiene mucha clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio, y que de esa forma lucha por poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener.
El Sr. Anibal pide el préstamo para invertirlo en materiales y herramientas para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Anibal is 33 years old and is from the city of Itá. He is a locksmith and owner of three locksmith outlets in various parts of the market.

Anibal tells us that, with a lot of sacrifice, he has many customers who always come to his business and so he is able to give his family everything that he could not have.

Anibal is applying for this loan to invest in materials and tools in order to continue with his work and fight to be better.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his locksmith business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married and works hard to support her family. She has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 22 years.

Rosario requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy abaca fiber for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Norma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and selling bamboo and charcoal. Norma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jijenge Self Help Group

texts.en: Joseph, a member of Jijenge Self Help Group, lives in the Murang'a area which lies in Central Kenya.  He has one child and has been a farmer for the last four years. His primary source of income is from farm produce - eggs, milk and crops.  He enjoys making money from agribusiness and wants to increase his farm's productivity by diversifying in agriculture. He decided to get a loan from Juhudi Kilimo because they offer training in managing agricultural assets and encourage farmers to save. His biggest challenge is getting cheap labor and feed for her cows during dry weather. This loan will not only benefit Joseph's family save the money they spend on kerosene, but also provide a clean and safe house lighting solution.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy Solar Lights

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus, 61 years old, is married and has five children, one child still in school. For the past 6 years, Venus has run an agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Venus has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a farmer living in Muranga, one of the towns in Central Kenya a little past Thika. She is married and has three children. She is a well established farmer who has been at it for 14 years, and this has been her main source of income, growing a variety of crops and rearing rabbits and poultry.

Caroline chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans, and also because they assist farmers by giving them training and good advice on farming. Through this loan she will be able to store sufficient water to pump to her crops and livestock for more growth and production. This will increase her income level and thus improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Kelfala

texts.en: This is 37 year-old Kelfala.  He is married and has two children aged 6 and 2 months. In 2004, Kelfala established his business selling drinks of different kinds. He began his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Kelfala requires a loan in order to buy more drinks of different kind for resale. In the future, Kelfala plans to expand his business for more development and to repay the loan. He is very hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks of different kind for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modify her cart and to buy stock for making pastries, stuffed potatoes and pork scratchings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of men's shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bags, plastic wear.

loans.name: Hannia Meliza

texts.es: Hannia es una reconocida vendedora de mercancía por catálogo ya que desde el colegio se ha dedicado a esta actividad la cual ha ejercido durante 10 años demostrando las ganas de trabajar y su preocupación por su hija de 1 año de edad ya que es madre soltera y gracias a este empleo puede darle todo lo que el padre le negó solicita un crédito que destinara exclusivamente para la compra de mercancía como lo es ropa para hombre y dama ya que la competencia está muy dura y solo las micro empresarias que tienen líneas nuevas pueden triunfar en este mercado, dándoles rotación a sus clientes mayoristas y diferentes estilos a sus clientes minoristas, su más grande aspiración es poder tener un local propio ya que sus productos los distribuye puerta a puerta, ser reconocida en la ciudad como una persona que nos hace vestir diferente y generar grandes ganancias las cuales invertirá todas en el futuro de su hija demostrando así que puede hacer el papel de madre y padre al mismo tiempo
texts.en:
Hannia is a recognized catalog saleswoman. She has been doing this work for the past ten years, since she was in high school. She has a good work ethic and, as a single mother, worries about supporting her 1-year-old daughter. The father does not help out, but thanks to her work, Hannia is able to provide for her daughter.

She requests a loan which will be used exclusively to purchase her merchandise, which is women's and men's clothing. Only the businesses who offer new lines can get ahead in this market, because the competition is very stiff. So Hannia needs to give her wholesale clients a good rotation, and also provide different styles to her walk-in customers. 

Her greatest aspiration is to have a shop of her own, because she currently distributes her products door-to-door. She also wants to be recognized in her city as a person who helps people dress distinctly. And she wants to generate a large income which she will invest completely into the future of her daughter, demonstrating that she can simultaneously fulfill the role of mother and father.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to give more variety to her wholesale clients, and new styles to her walk-in customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cutlery and pots for the business.

loans.name: 11 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Yến is 41-years-old and married with three children.  She is the group leader of 11 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of six members.  Yến lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Yến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: 12 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs .Tuyển works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Tuyển is 38 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 12 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of five members. Tuyển lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyển first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyển faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyển hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to  raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 45 years old and married with two school-age and four adult children. She lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba, Mis. Occ. Marlyn has been planting corn for 6 years and joined Paglaum in 2008. She has an income of 3,000 Philippine pesos per month. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer for her corn. The profit she earns from corn planting is used to cover the tuition fees of her two children and to save for college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar, 54 years old, lives in Oroquieta-Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She was gifted with five children. 

She plants vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities such as root crops. In a couple of weeks, she will harvest and sell her produce to the market. 

In need of additional working capital, Pilar decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 20,000 to redeem pawned land in which she could use the land for planting any agricultural commodity to earn more income. Being member in good standing of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. 

She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a four-wheel vehicle someday to use for delivering her own agricultural products to nearby towns.

loans.use: to redeem pawned land

loans.name: Quecesiah

texts.en: Quecesiah is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She studied Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, Marketing Management in a university. Her parents were both earning from their buy and sell business. Quecesiah often helps her parents to watch over their own store on weekends and in his free time. With her GDMPC education loan, she will be able to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester. Hopefully in the future, she will find a better job according to her desire.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase candy, calamine, pepper, garlic, plastic and other products to continue her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emelinda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda previously requested a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

Luzviminda requested another loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. 

Luzviminda hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela, 28 years old, has two children, one in school, She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 10 years, Shiela has run a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Shiela would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nieselda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nieselda works hard to support her family. She has a pre-paid mobile load business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Natasha products. Nieselda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase SIM and additional pre-paid loads to sell for her business.

Nieselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase SIM and additional pre-paid mobile loads to sell

loans.name: Viflor

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Viflor works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and tricycle transportation. Viflor is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her business.

Viflor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a native mat weaving business in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business. She has been in this business for four years now. Amalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her manicure and pedicure business. Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, 31 years old, is married and has two children, one in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For the past 7 years, Michelle has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from jeepney transportation. Geneva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Geneva has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta, 38 years old, is married and has four children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, Antonieta has run a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has two children aged twenty-three and fourteen. In 2008, Kadiatu established her business selling foil wrappers, serving plates, foil bowls, ketch-up, mayonnaise and other provisions. She began her business because she believes that business is the only way out for her to progress in life. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults.

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to pay for more provisions, paper plates, and foil bowls. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business status and also her living standard. In the future, Kadiatu plans to meet her daughter’s educational needs at the university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more provisions, paper plates, and foil bowls

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell. Rebecca has been in this business for 16 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Meet Lucy, a mixed farmer in Chuka, Kenya. For the last fifteen years, she has been selling milk, eggs and tea from her farm to afford her three children a decent living. She also engages in other small business ventures to make extra money.

The part of farming she enjoys most is feeding her cows. “I get, more or less, the same feeling when I am feeding my cattle as when I am feeding my children. My children fill my heart, my cows fill my pocket!” she said. The biggest challenge, however, is poor market prices. 

A few years ago, Lucy could not get financed by banks because she was ruled a high-risk client due to the nature of the small-scale farming business. Today, she is a member of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that targets smallholder farmers who are financially excluded. “I joined Juhudi because as a farmer, I needed financial assistance, and Juhudi was there for me,” Lucy said. “During group meetings I learnt that I can develop more as a farmer if only I expand my farm enterprise through loans,” she continued.

Lucy is before you seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. She plans on insuring the cow immediately after purchase to protect her investment and your loan. A dairy cow will provide a source of regular income for Lucy to repay the loan and expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Daniel. Daniel lives in Kitale together with his wife and children. To afford his family a decent living, he sells milk, eggs and varieties of food crops produced at his farm. He has nine years of experience in mixed farming. Selling his farm produce gives him a sense of personal satisfaction. His biggest challenge, however, is the high cost of transportation. 

Daniel mobilized a group of other smallholder farmers and registered the group by the name Twiga Sango SHG. Through the group, they managed to join Juhudi Kilimo granting them access to low interest loans from an institution that understands the needs of smallholder, rural farmers. Daniel is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will be insured immediately after purchase to protect Daniel’s investment. A high-grade dairy cow will produce enough milk daily to enable Daniel to comfortably service the loan. Your donation towards Daniel’s loan will go a long way in improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Meet Patrick, 57, a father and a farmer with more than ten years of experience in mixed farming. He lives together with his children in Murang’a, an area of Kenya known for coffee for export plantations. His primary income source is dairy.

Generating an income through selling his produce is the part of farming he enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Patrick. 

Before joining Juhudi, Patrick could not access loans from banks, since they considered him a high-risk client. He mobilized neighbouring farmers and created a group called Sunrise Support Group. Through the group, he joined Juhudi Kilimo and learnt about loan management and agribusiness. He also got to learn about Kiva. Patrick is seeking a loan for constructing a cow shed. 

With your loan, Patrick will construct a cowshed and introduce zero grazing. This will boost his income and enable him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like pepper, bitter ball, and okra to resell at her business.

loans.name: Comfort M

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Comfort M. She is married and has a one year old child year and a 10 month old baby. 

In 2012, Comfort M. established her Pure Drinking Water business. She began her business because her mother was a single parent and had to engage in petty trading in order to provide for their basic needs. Though Comfort M. was in school she usually helped her mother in selling goods from place to place. She grew up to be a business woman. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,618,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Comfort M. requires a loan in order to purchase bundles of pure water and beverages. In the future, Comfort M. plans to build a house and expand her business. She is a hardworking woman. The loan will be a great help to her and she looking forward to subsequent loans.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of pure water and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for clothes, footwear, jackets, and bags for her general store business.

loans.name: Glen View 4 Vendors Group

texts.en: Rumbidzai is 40 years old and married with four children; two of whom still attend school. She also cares for two other dependents. She operates a vegetable market in Glen View, Harare. She has been in this business for 20 years. She sells fruit and vegetables to the local market and has no other source of income. The main challenges the client faces are stiff competition in the business and fluctuations in prices from suppliers. Rumbidzai requested a loan of $400 to replenish her stocks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She says the extra income generated will enable the client to send her children to better schools. She says she is grateful to Kiva and Microking for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 37, is married with four children residing in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for 19 years while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 97,000 per day and can save about KHR 60,000 each day for future needs.
 
Pov has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is requesting a new loan to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute to work. She hopes to reduce on motor-taxi expenses so as to better her living condition.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 46, is a citizen of Kampong Cham Province, and she is married. She has seven children, one of whom is in school.

Rice farming is the main source of her income, and she earns extra income via paid work in order to cover her daily cost of living in her household. She is in the second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has completely repaid her past loan. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR, and she will spend her entire loan to buy a cow to support her in plowing her paddy rice field. She strongly hopes to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to support her family’s business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
