A resident from a rural village of the Kampong Siem district, Hay is 41 years old. The main source of family’s income is from growing beans and farming rice. Having been in this business for 23 years, she is able to earn 64,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Hay with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Netser

texts.en:
Nester is an 18-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been buying and selling clothing for over six months while volunteering as a learner Guide in a local secondary school. 

Nester is applying for a 500 USD loan through Camfed Zimbabwe to buy clothes in bulk to sell. This will help increase her profit margins and grow her business. With her additional profits she hopes to create employment in her community and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a married woman, 30 years old. She is married with two children. She lives in Mwenezi District. 

Memory has a flea market in Mwenezi district. She started her business in the middle of last year. She sells both new clothes and second-hand clothes. She is volunteering as a learner guide within her local community, providing life and leadership skills within the local schools.

With the Kiva loan, Memory intends to expand her business. She wants to purchase more stock. She also intends to build a better shade for her business. This will enable her to stabilize and to make more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock to increase sales.

loans.name: Reth Rom's Group

texts.en:
Reth is a 30-year-old farmer from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with two children; one attends school. 

She grows cassava which has been the  main source of her income for 12 years. This is the sixth cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a team leader of three.  

The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to gradually improve her lifestyle.   As the leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and pay for plowing, labor, and harvesting fees. 

She hopes to gain a better yield than before and to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se conformó en el año 2009, es un grupo muy trabajador que lleva varios años luchando y trabajando. Ellas además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar  a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la venta de comida  en horas de la tarde y por la mañana es empleada doméstica. Hoy ella es viuda y se encuentra luchando sola, pero esforzándose por poder trabajar y salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer comidas variadas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y demás.  Todas ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
The committee was formed in 2009 and it is a very hard-working group that has been fighting and working for several years. In addition to the independent work of each woman, they also carry out activities as a group. At the same time, they help each other reach their goals which is to work to support their families.

One very touching story is that of Maria who makes a living selling food in the afternoon while in the morning she is a housekeeper. Nowadays, she is a widow and she finds herself struggling alone, but pushing herself to be able to work and come out ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy goods to make an assortment of food, such as vegetables, meat, condiments and more. All of the women are thankful for the opportunity they are getting to continue growing and fighting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and more.

loans.name: Nolipaz

texts.en: Nolipaz is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a community based store business in the village, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Nolipaz is borrowing PHP 7,000 through ASKI in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, candies and rice to sell in her store business. Nolipaz has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from ASKI and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, candies and rice to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 54 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Mary has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending. Mary aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: As a parent of two children, Jessica works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sound system rentals. Jessica is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more used shoes to sell for her buy and sell used shoes business. Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Nelma works hard to support her family. She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling spices. Nelma is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy recycled materials to resell. Nelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She sells used shoes in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Marilyn requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional sacks of used shoes to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Srun Son's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Srun is 27 years old and married with one child. To make a living, she has been farming and supplements her family’s income by working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about 80,000 riels (KHR) per day and can save about 40,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Srun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her to have enough household supplies for her family. She is now leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Srun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 45 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Marivic has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from videoke rental. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tobacco vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more tobacco for her tobacco vending business. Elena has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from a general store. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco for her business.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 58 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Dionesia works very hard to provide for them.

Dionesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, shampoo, detergent soap, sanitary pads, candies, eggs, etc. to sell.

Dionesia has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, detergent soap, sanitary pads, candies, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Dionesia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, shampoo, detergent soap, sanitary pads, candies and eggs to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Catalinas Ixtahuacan Group

texts.en:
Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán is a town located in the highlands of Guatemala. Ixtahuacán is a word in the Mayan Kiche language that means “plain to cultivate." Almost half of the population of this town lives in poverty that has a tremendous effect on children and women. There are few opportunities for development.

Seven hardworking and motivated ladies are hopeful for a better and more prosperous future and have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Catalinas Ixtahuacan.” They are requesting a loan that they will use for their textile and agricultural businesses with the goal of improving their standard of living. 

A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer meets with the women at their monthly meetings. Besides conducting business transactions, the Loan Officer presents educational training and the ladies can immediately put the newly acquired information to work in their lives. They are eager to learn about effective business practices, budgeting, and accounting. The women also learn about hygiene, health and medicinal plants. Other relevant subjects include nutrition, self esteem, and women’s rights. 

Manuela is an active and enthusiastic member of the Trust Bank. She has a textile business and creates beautiful traditional skirts called “cortes.” Actually, she shares this responsibility with her family and her husband and children work with her. Manuela has requested a loan which she will use to purchase thread and dye. She looks forward to increased sales to her neighbors and clients in nearby villages and will work hard to create the designs that they choose.

The ladies of the Trust Bank extend their gratitude and appreciation to Kiva investors for helping them achieve their dreams. They anticipate a more prosperous future because of the tools that they are acquiring now with the loans and education.

loans.use: To purchase thread and dye

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes de Koury qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Achat de Tissus, Condiments, Restauration, Lait et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles Sont à leur huitième cycle de prêt solidaire. 
Oumou  assise au milieu est une vendeuse de lait pur. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des bidons de lait au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ce lait auprès des peulhs dans les villages environnant de Koury.  
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Oumou compte réaliser  125 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women from Koury, who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 49 years of age and have at least five children each.

This group of women buy and sell a variety of products such as  fabrics, condiments, ingredients for restauration activities, milk and others. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their eighth group loan cycle.

Oumou, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, sells pure mild. She is planning to use her loan to buy containers of milk as and when she sells them, on a retail basis to a mixed customer base. She gets this milk from Peulhs in the villages surrounding Koury.

While the other members of the Djekafo group expect to make an average monthly profit of 120,000FCFA each during this cycle, Oumou expects to make 125,000FCFA. 

As well as using their income to repay their loans, they also use part of it to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses; They would like to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they do not run out of stock.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Alanaya 14123 Group

texts.en: Ghinwa is the featured borrower of Alanaya 14123 Group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. Ghinwa is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working in a beauty business for the past ten years. Currently Ghinwa runs her business at home and provides beauty services at customers' homes upon request. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to change her car's engine since her car is very necessary for business development. This is because of the extra services she provides to customers who ask her to come to their house. She hopes that in the future she can open her own beauty salon and develop her career. Ghinwa is the lady at the center of the picture with dyed blond hair wearing jeans. As for the other group members, Alia is the first from the right, Najat is the second from the right, Manal is the first from the left, and Siham is the second from the left.

loans.use: to change her car's engine since her car is very necessary for providing beauty services at customers' homes upon request

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah (pictured here), age 46, lives in Phnom Penh suburb. She has three sons and three daughters. One of her children is a construction worker, two have full-time employment, one stays at home and other two are still young. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. 

Sarah sells food and Khmer noodles from home. Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia that can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber.

The kitchen where she cooks is old and breaking down. Sarah wants to rebuild it, so she decided to apply for a loan. 

Sarah is Cham Muslim.  The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia, with a population estimated at 200,000 to 300,000 out of Cambodia's population of about 13 million people (2008).  The Cham have a proud past, with the Champa kingdom ruling much of what is present-day Vietnam from the 2nd century to 9th century. The modern history of the Cham in Cambodia is marked by tragedy, as the genocidal Khmer Rouge prioritized the extermination of Muslims, Buddhists, and others of faith during their rule from 1975 to 1979.

loans.use: To rebuild the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy aluminum for his workshop

loans.name: Munhtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Munhtulga is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their Ger (a traditional nomadic yurt) on rental land in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His wife, Gantsooj who is 28, works as a local secondary school teacher. She is currently on her maternity leave, taking care of her eight-month-old son and five-year-old daughter. 

Munhtulga started his taxi service business in town two years ago. He is a hardworking, diligent man who provides safe and reliable transportation to local residents. He wants to increase his income to provide a decent living to his family and purchase a small plot of land for family use. 

Munhtulga is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to replace on his car. The car is used for his taxi service business which stabilizes the family income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to replace on his car

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a 42-year-old disabled man from Potungan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married and has one school-age child. Raul is very responsible about supporting his family.

Raul is a mechanic. He is also engaged in selling spare motor parts on a retail basis. Raul is applying for a loan because he needs capital to purchase additional spare parts to sell. In the future, Raul deeply wishes to support his child's education save money to expand his store.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare motor parts

loans.name: Herlyn

texts.en: Herlyn is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Herlyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed. Herlyn has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Herlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 61 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Regina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Regina has been raising pigs for 32 years, and also earns additional income from bread vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 29 years old, and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase eggs, oil, sugar, coffee, cream, soft drinks, etc. Gina has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, oil, sugar, coffee, cream, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 40 years old. He sells livestock such as chickens, ducks and rabbits. He has been in the business for the past twelve years.  With the loan, he would like to buy more animals for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy more animals for sale. He is very focused on a better business for the future.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits, roosters, ducks, and hens for sale

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.en: Evaliste is 33 years old. He deals with saloon products such as shampoos, clippers and hair plants and he has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shampoos, and clippers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house

loans.use: to buy more equipment to use in the barber shop

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janvier is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman. They both run the same business of selling foodstuffs. They have both spent four years in the business. 

With the loan, they would like to buy more beans, cooking oil and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, cooking oil and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Cooproriz Mirayi G1 Group

texts.en:
Antoinnette is 48 years old. She has seven children aged between seventeen and eight. She is the group leader. With the loan, she would to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. In the picture, Antionnette holds a red file as a sign of identification from her fellow group members.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: La Fortune 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
A short man with a welcoming personality, Julien is the father of five children and the proud owner of a small market stall selling food and various other goods, such as boxes, sardines, and vegetables.

Julien is a member of the group La Fortune 2 (1), and heads up a group of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. Julien has just started his very first loan cycle with Hope Congo, and plans to use his loan of 200,000 CFA to purchase additional merchandise for his market stall, selling food and various other goods such as boxes, sardines, and vegetables. 

Through this loan, Julien will be able to purchase more goods to increase his profits, enabling him to provide for his family. Eventually, Julien hopes to open his own food and convenience store in the future, and expand to other parts of Brazzaville. 

Julien dreams that his children will be able to finish school and eventually go into the a trade business as well. He also hopes to purchase a piece of land so that he can build his family a home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for his stall, such as vegetables and sardines.

loans.name: Bethesaïda (2) Group

texts.en:
Rufinne is an engaging seamstress with a shy smile, who makes dresses and other traditional clothing items for women in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. Rufinne has two children, ages seven and three, and takes care of her niece. 

She has been a member of the group Bethesaïda (2) at Hope Congo for the past two years, and wants to use a loan of 400,000 CFA to invest in her sewing business. Rufinne plans to purchase office supplies, an additional sewing machine, and cloth to continue to grow her business.

Bringing in her clients with a smile and warm welcome, Rufinne dreams of being able to purchase an additional sewing machines in the future to grow her business, eventually moving to a shop in another quarter of the city. 

She hopes to save up enough to put her children through school and eventually buy a piece of land to build her own home on. Rufinne helps lead a sub-group of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs and has been sewing for over 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies, an additional sewing machine, and cloth to continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is married and has four children, two of whom attend school. For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned  price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Mbodze requests for a loan from Yehu, which she will to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Al- Tafaol Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Al- Tafaol Al- Hodeidah is a group that consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.
 
Sada is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. Her oldest child is 32 years old and the youngest one is 23 years old. She is the leader of the group. Sada lives with her family in a simple house in a poor area in Hodeidah. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. He was an employee in the public sector. Recently, he has retired and his retirement pension isn't enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Also, Sada works in the cafeteria of the national institute in Hodeidah. The salary that she receives from this business is very small .For this reason, Sada decided to start her own business in order to improve living conditions for the family. Four years ago, Sada started her own business selling makeup, accessories, and cosmetics. She wants to enlarge her business, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her children. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more incense, perfumes, and accessories and resell them.

Sada looks forward to enlarging her business through purchasing more cosmetics, accessories, and women's clothes. Also, she hopes to open a small shop selling chips, Sambusa, some kinds of drinks, and other kinds of food.

loans.use: To purchase more incense, perfumes, and accessories and resell them.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is an agriculturalis in the remote village of Nyarubungo Masha in the Isingiro district. He is married with five children, and all are in school. He started cattle keeping at the early age of 12, as it was the main economic activity in his village. After the death of his father, he struggled a lot to make his mother survive through cattle farming until he managed to put up his own family, which has made him even start his own farm. He is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more cattle for fattening. He is optimistic this will take him a long way.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 52 years old. She is a single mother with grown-up children. She is known for being hard working and responsible, with a will for personal achievement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she was not able to study for a career, but she would have liked to study in the clinical nursing program.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, she has a business selling diapers, plastic bowls and plates at her residence. She works at her business 12 hours a day, offering her products. She carries out her business at her residence and through orders from regular and prospective customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the not-too-distant future, she can obtain better income. Florence appreciates the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources.

loans.use: To buy diapers, plastic bowls and plates to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a 54-year-old woman and a repeat client of the organization. She is a widow but has managed to raise her three children. She hails from Bucence village, Kigaaga ward, Western division, Rukungiri municipality. She is securing a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings to buy organic fertilizers to help improve her crop productivity.

She is a hardworking lady, and her main business is agriculture, which she has done for a good number of years.  She has been able to cater for her family's basic needs and also pay school fees for her children from this business.

Her dream is to expand her agriculture business and produce more, but her main challenge has been insufficient capital. She appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial support they have rendered to her.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a repeat client, aged 38 years. She is married and looks after three children. She applied for a loan of UGX 3,500,000, to improve her business of goat-rearing by buying cross breed goats which will enhance her productivity and profits. She has a challenge of little business turnover from her goat business, which has been majorly a result of limited capital.  She decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase her goat business so that she can grow it to high levels. She is very hard-working.
Pictured is Alice with her husband at their farm.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Nsambya West Group

texts.en:
Allen is a first time borrower of UGAFODE applying for UGX 2,000,000. She is a single lady and a graduate from university who has managed to start a retail shop as a way of survival.  Fresh from university, she had some money that she used to start the shop. She is proud of the shop and not lamenting why she is not engaged in a job of her profession. Despite this, Allen has challenges, which include not being able to meet all her client’s demands.  She needs money to stock up her shop with the goods that are on high demand, thus increasing her sales and gross profits.
Allen has future hope of seeing her shop expand into a bigger one and also going back to university for a Masters course in business in order to enhance her business growth and profitability.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise to sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is aged 33 and married. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Geraldine operates a nursery school in the city outskirts as a source of income.

Geraldine started a kindergarten school in 2011, after her graduation as a teacher. Currently her school has many children, thus she needs a loan to expand the school premises by constructing classrooms for the growing population of pupils.

Because of her good work and honesty, Geraldine has been able to grow her business very fast. She hopes with financial aid from UGAFODE and support of Kiva lenders she will be able to provide quality service to the community. Pictured is Geraldine a her sister (guarantor.

loans.use: to buy building materials to expand her school premises

loans.name: Maqsood Ali

texts.en:
Maqsood Ali is 29 years old and married. He is an energetic man living with his spouse and a son in the area of Afandi Colony, Hyderabad, Pakistan. 

He owns a business manufacturing packing boxes. He has been running this business for the last 6 years. At the beginning, it was not very profitable, but with the passage of time, he has established the business on a grand level. Now, there are six co-workers also working with him. 

Maqsood Ali purchases raw materials from markets such as corn starch glue, cardboard, brightly colored inks, and cutter machines. After manufacturing the packing boxes, he supplies them to the shopkeepers. 

He manages his household necessities with his business. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and easily wins the trust of others. This is a reason that his number of regular clients increases day-by-day. 

He wants to expand his box making business. He is in need of a cardboard cutting machine. Therefore, Maqsood Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he will be able to buy a cutting machine to improve his packing box business. 

He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business. He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system. He is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new cutting machine for packing boxes.

loans.name: Akhlima

texts.en:
Akhlima, who is a 48-year-old housewife, lives in a remote region of Jalpaiguri with her two children (one daughter and one son) and her husband. She is illiterate and only can sign her name.  Her husband Majibar, age 54, is a cultivator by profession.  Their two children go to school and both are in grade eight.

Akhlima's husband grows seasonal vegetables and sells the produces in the local market.  He earns so little from his agricultural activities that it has become very difficult for them to bear the educational costs and household expenditures.  They need to expand the business by cultivating some different crops, which they think should be jute, a very profitable crop.

In order to help her husband, Akhlima has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other materials needed for cultivation of jute. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the children's education.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Akhlima dreams of being able to buy another plot of land to expand her farm with the profit.

She wants to give her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other materials needed to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Najima

texts.en:
Najima is a married young lady of only 22 years. She is from the small village of Altagram in the Jalpaiguri district. She lives there with her husband and their son. She attended school up to grade five. Her son is too young to go to school.
 
Najima's husband is a humble and hardworking man. He is totally engaged in agriculture. Najima also helps her husband. They give hard toil on their farmland. It is the only way to earn their living. This tradition has been passed on from generation to generation; that's how he learn the activity. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells in the local markets and to his neighbors to generate income to contribute to the family economy. 

Now they plan to expand their agribusiness by cultivating eggplant, which is a profitable crop.

Najima is requesting a loan from BJS to purchase eggplant seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to continue cultivating and caring for her crops and obtain a more productive harvest. With the spirit to get ahead and the determination to prosper, she wants to continue with the business and make it more and more profitable so that she can give her family a better quality of life. At the same time, she wants to upgrade her house to a concrete-made house with the profit from her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing eggplants.

loans.name: Sahirun

texts.en:
Sahirun is a very young housewife from the village Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives there with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  Her husband is a farmer.   

Sahirun's husband runs a farming business. He is totally involved in cultivation. He grows different vegetables like potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes and different green vegetables. He is a hardworking man and loves his work.  Sahirun also helps him in his work in different ways, especially at the time of harvesting, after managing her household work.  As it is their only source of income for the family, they devote most of their time to this business.   

With the goal of further developing their business Sahirun applied for financial support from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  They have decided to cultivate jute which is a very profitable crop.  Sahirun has decided to utilize the loan to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.  She intends to have a good harvest that will contribute toward a higher income.

She gives her thanks to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase jute seed, fertilizers, and pesticides for cultivation.

loans.name: Monobala

texts.en:
Monobala is 38-year-old, married woman from Maynaguri. She is illiterate, just knows how to sign her name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive an education. Now Monobala is a mother of three children and two of them go to school. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is a farmer. 

Both Monobala and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children. Monobala lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with this profit from her business she will try to make a Pakka house (made of bricks and cement). They face lot of problems in the mud house especially in times of natural disaster. Monobala is now successfully running her milk business and has taken hold on the market for selling milk products.

Monobala is very much happy and thankful to Kiva and BJS for funding her.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an efficient and affordable cooking energy package that uses liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: 27 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “27 DE MARZO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mariela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de víveres, salón de belleza, cotillonería, venta de comida, venta de helado, repostería, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mariela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que ella estudio de hace varios años en una institución técnica y contaba con una máquina de costura, posteriormente decide establecer un taller donde realiza ahora sus productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará de forma en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud y las capacitaciones que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "27 de marzo" (27th of March) will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center. It is composed of nine members and it is led by a board of directors where Señora Mariela is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied. Among them are: selling groceries, beauty salon, party supplies, selling food, selling ice cream, confectionery, and selling blankets.

The loan that they will take out will benefit this little group of microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Mariela is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, entering at the invitation of her sister, who is a member of the institution. At this time her business is a sewing workshop. She relates that she began this business a  number of years ago, since she studied some years ago in a technical institution and had a sewing machine. Later she decided to establish a workshop where she now makes her own products.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital. She will buy fabric wholesale in the wholesale shops of the city of El Alto, and after making her products, she will sell them in the fairs of the city of La Paz. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, since she is single and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health service and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Amigas De Kalaque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE KALAQUE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pesca, venta y compra de ganado, venta de leche, tejido de mantas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca y tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprende hace varios años, ya que el mismo era un negocio familiar, posterior a su matrimonio decide iniciar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red de pesca) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente instalará en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta presente el esposo de una de las socias, el esta de espaldas y tiene un sombrero.
texts.en:
The community bank group "Amigas de Kalaque" ["Friends from Kalaque"] begins its first cycle at ProMujer at the regional center of Achacachi. The group is composed of eight members and is headed by a board of which Sonia is the President. The members of this community association have businesses that are varied and include fishing, buying and selling cattle, selling milk, and weaving blankets. The loan is a great help to micro-entrepreneurs like Sonia. She reports that this is her first time taking out a loan with ProMujer. She entered on the invitation of a consultant who visited her home. Today she has a fishing business and weaves blankets. She reports that she has been in business for several years, since she used to be involved in a family business and once she was married she started an independent one. 
The loan will bring a capital increase for the purchase of fishing nets that she will buy in the markets in the city of El Alto and brought back to her fishing space. Her work will allow her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has three children.
When asked what she likes about ProMujer, Sonia replies that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Manos Unidas  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona bien rural, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Eduarda es una de las integrantes, ella es vendedora de ropas usadas, aparte tiene una despensa y también una moto carro en el que acarrea cargas y realiza un servicio de flete. Como se puede ver, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas usadas para poder seguir con su venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The "Manos Unidas" group is on its first loan cycle with the women's committee programme. The group comes from the city of Concepción, found in a region a little far from the centre of Nicaragua. The region here is growing. It is a very rural area and so the members want to fight to continue growing and to make the area more lively.

Eduarda is one member of the group; she makes a living selling second-hand clothing. She also has a grocery store, and a motorcycle which she uses to transport goods and passengers. As you can see, Eduarda is a very hard-working woman. With a lot of effort she is getting ahead in order to give her loved ones everything that she herself could not have.

Eduarda is applying for this loan in order to buy used clothes to continue with her sales. With it she can continue to expand her business and give her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Kuña Kyre.y”   está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de los 15 Señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, que irán mejorando por medio de las constantes capacitaciones para seguir unidas y crecer juntas.
Antonia es la presidenta de este grupo, ella vende condimentos variados, un trabajo muy humilde, pero que hace con muchas ganas, ya que de esa forma puede ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar condimentos variados, y de esa forma poder tener los ingresos para ayudar a su familia y a la vez ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Kyrey" group is on its first loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where all of the (women) members promise to work and help each other to get ahead. The members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey; three of the members live under the poverty line. The members will progress through constant training to keep them together and growing.

Antonia is the president of this group. She makes a living with a humble job selling various condiments. She does her work with great enthusiasm as, through it, she can help her family and loved ones.

Antonia is applying for this loan in order to buy condiments and to continue to earn a living for her family and grow.

loans.use: to buy condiments to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 48 años de edad, es casada  tiene dos  hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros,  tiene  un local propio y en una muy buena ubicación.
Se inició como vendedora ambulante y luego con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo pudo montar su local propio, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, ya que así podrá surtirse y dar a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living selling clothes for men and women. She has her own premises in a very good location.

María started her work as a street vendor. Later, with a lot of sacrifice and effort, she was able to find premises and, so far, the business is going very well. She has regular customers as she has been working in this field for some time.

María is applying for this loan in order to buy clothes to sell. With more clothes she can stock up and offer her customers the variety that they are used to.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es: José tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 20 años, 18 años y 6 años de edad. José trabaja muy duro en un taller para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Es un hombre comprometido a su familia quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sacando adelante a su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionles ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor lateral de su su vivienda y poder así adecuar la cocina dentro de un lugar seguro. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder mejorar sus condiciones y las de su familia mediante la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and his three children ages 20, 18 and 6. José works very hard in a repair shop to provide for his household. He is a man committed to his family and has worked hard to get his family ahead. 

With the desire to improve his living conditions, he has made the decision of requesting this loan to invest in the construction of a side corridor in his home. That way he would be able to place the kitchen in a safe place. With the requested amount, he will buy galvanized sheets, wood and nails. He hopes to be able to better his living conditions and those of his family through the improvement of his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood and nails to build a corridor in his home.

loans.name: Magdaly

texts.es:
Vemos personas transitando por la calle y lo que menos imaginamos es que su vestimenta proviene de una tienda de segunda mano.  Tal vez esa camisa o pantalón salió de la pequeña tienda de Magdaly. Ella dio sus primeros pasos al comercio vendiendo comida, pero con el tiempo descubrió que la venta de ropa usada es un negocio más rentable. Su puesto se encuentra situado en un punto  clave en donde hay mucha afluencia de personas.
Con la ayuda de su esposo su tienda ha ido creciendo. Magdaly  desea continuar con el mismo ritmo de ventas y por supuesto,  planea aumentar su inventario con prendas de buena calidad, siguiendo  las últimas  tendencias de la moda.  Por lo tanto, solicitó un financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito  para comprar más producto como ropa y calzado, para contar con variedad de productos de esa forma tendrá otras opciones que ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Las ganancias serán a beneficio del negocio y  la familia.
texts.en:
We see people walking down the street and little do we know that their clothing comes from a second hand shop. Maybe this shirt or these pants came from Magdaly Espinoza's store. She made her start in business selling food buy with time came to realize that selling used clothing was a more profitable business. Her stand is located in a key position where there is a lot of foot traffic. With the help of her husband her shop has been growing.

Magdaly wants to continue this same rhythm of sales and of course plans to increase her inventory with good quality clothing following the latest fashions. So she has requested a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to buy more product like clothing and footwear so she will have more options to offer her clients. The profits will benefit her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en: Eda is 53 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Eda has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing. Eda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of used clothes to sell. Gloria has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and works hard to support her family. She sells bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Lolita requested a loan for NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks of banana to sell. She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Luís Eduvige

texts.es:
Luís tiene 29 años es agricultor, está soltero, estudio segundo año de bachillerato, él vive con su papá y su mamá, de él dependen dos personas.

Luís es ganadero, compra y vende ganado también cabras, este negocio lo aprendió por su padre.  El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ganado, desea que su ganado se desarrolle en buenas condiciones y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis, 29, is a farmer.  He's single and completed the second year of high school.  He lives with his father and mother; two people are dependent on him.

Luis is a rancher.  He buys and sells livestock.  He also has goats.  He learned this business from his father.

He'll use the loan to buy livestock.  He wants his animals to develop in good condition so he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia  es una joven de 21años de edad y que estudio hasta bachillerato,  comenta que no cuenta con los ingresos suficiente para seguir la universidad, ella está casada su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería en construcción.  Actualmente ellos no tienen hijos solo ellos dos viven en su vivienda.


Yesenia  se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y cuidar de su esposo, actualmente ella está sin trabajo ya que ella está esperando una oportunidad de trabajo de secretario, Yesenia acaba de terminar sus estudios secundarios  en el cual ya tiene su título para poder trabajar.

El crédito Yesenia lo utilizara para mejorar su vivienda debido a que la están construyendo y no han terminado y les falta construir el piso de su vivienda,  que es específicamente en lo que invertirán el crédito. Ella específicamente construirá el piso de su vivienda comprara 4 metros cuadrados de arena, 10 bolsas de cementó y la mano de obra que la hara su esposo porque es albañil,  esto con el único propósito de estar más cómodos sin peligro de que se puedan enfermar por insectos y hongos que se encuentran en el piso de la casa.

El deseo que tiene Yesenia es seguir estudiando en la universidad, ya que ella le gusta la carrera de laboratorio clínico, poder remodelar más la casa con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja y el crédito que han solicitado y con futuros que solicitara y también ella desea tener 2 hijos una niña y un niño para ser madre.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 21 years old and completed high school. She tells us that she did not have enough money to continue on to university. Yesenia is married; her husband is a builder. The couple does not have any children and they are the only two living in their house.

Yesenia does the household chores and looks after her husband. She is currently unemployed but is waiting for an opportunity to work as a secretary. Yesenia has just completed her secondary education and has her certificate to go out and work.

Yesenia will use her loan to make improvements to her home, which she is currently still building. She needs to install a floor in her home, for which she will use her loan. Yesenia will use the loan to buy sand to cover four square metres of floor and ten bags of cement; she will also pay for her husband's building services to do the work. The floor is being installed to make the house more comfortable and safe from the risk of becoming ill due to the presence of fungi and insects.

Yesenia's wish is to study at university; she would like to study to work in a hospital lab. She would also like to do further work on the house with the help of her husband and of this and future loans. Yesenia would also like to be a mother - she wants to children, one boy and one girl.

loans.use: to buy sand to cover four square metres of floor, and ten bags of cement; and to pay for her husband's building services to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer impulsada únicamente por el amor que siente hacia su hijo de 13 años, quien ha sido el que le ilumina la vida todos días. Ella es madre soltera y ha tenido que correr con todos los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente tiene un pequeño almacén de ropa en el cual exhibe y vende ropa para toda clase de personas.
Solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor y así tener un poco de utilidad en la compra, esto le permitirá un inventario de mercancía mas amplio y variado para ofrecer a sus clientes que son la base de su negocio.
Su mayor anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y extenderlo a diferentes partes de la ciudad, abriendo almacenes en otros sectores.
Y su sueño es poder ver a su hijo crecer y ser una persona exitosa.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman motivated solely by the love that she feels for her 13-year-old son, who has been the light of her life every day. She is a single mother, and she has had to cover all of her household expenses. 

Currently, she has a little clothing store in which she displays and sells clothing for all kinds of people. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise wholesale, and thus gain some value on the purchase. This will allow her to have a bigger and more varied inventory of merchandise to offer to her customers, who are the foundation of her business.

Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business and extend it into other parts of the city, opening shops in other sectors. Her dream is to be able to see her son grow and to be a successful person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale, and thus gain some value on the purchase.

loans.name: Luz Miladis

texts.es:
Luz, una mujer de 35 años tiene una gran convicción de salir adelante junto a su hijo de 14 años.
Ella se desempeña en la cría, producción y venta de cerdos de levante, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre quien desde muy pequeña le enseño a esforzarse y trabajar duro para cumplir con sueños.
Esta mentalidad la ha tenido toda su vida y es la que la ha llevado a ser la emprendedora que es hoy en día.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar crías de cerdo y así poder tener una producción más estable. Al comprar estos animales podrá tener un impulso bastante bueno en su actividad y conseguirá los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Ella lo único que quiere en la vida es que su hijo estudie y sea un profesional, así podrá tener una posición económica más fuerte.
texts.en:
Luz is a 35 year old woman with a lot of desire to get ahead along with her 14 year old son. She works breeding, raising and selling pigs. She learned this at an early age from her father who taught her to make the effort and work hard to achieve your dreams. She has had this attitude all her life and this has lead her to be the entrepreneur she is today.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and have a more stable production. Buying these animals will give an good boost to her business and generate the income needed to support her family. All she wants in life is for her son to study and become a professional. then he will have a better economic situation.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Gabriela Karina

texts.es: Karina es una señora de 23 años de edad, vive en una casa prestada juntamente con su esposo y su hijo de 5 años que asiste a la escuela, comenta que se dedica unos  5 años al negocio  de las frutas, trabaja con sus padres y  este negocio es familiar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para comercializarlas, dice que se transporta a diferentes ferias de algunas ciudades, la aspiración de Karina es  mejorar su negocio y variar mas sus productos para ofrecer buena mercadería a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Carina is a 23-year-old woman. She lives in a borrowed house with her husband and her 5-year-old son, who goes to school. She says that she has been selling fruits for five years. She works with her parents and it is a family business.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruits for selling. She says that she travels to different fairs in some cities. Carina’s ambition is to improve her business and offer a greater variety of products in order to offer good merchandise to her clients. By this she wants to increase her income and buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Edgar Facundo

texts.es:
Edgar de 31 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a que sus padres ya no lo pusieron a estudiar si no que a trabajar la tierra,  él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar y cuidar de su pequeña hija de tres años de edad.
	
Edgar se dedica  a trabajar en un carro que es de él, haciendo viajes y jalando personas de un lugar a otro,  él tiene ya cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad el mismo tiempo que tiene de haber comprado el vehiculó, el trabajo lo aprendió gracias a un tío que le enseño a manejar y luego compro su propio vehículo, él también tiene otra actividad que es la agricultura la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) tiene una amplia experiencia en esta área todo gracias a su padre que le enseño a trabajar la tierra y en algunas oportunidades recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que requiere ayuda.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda,  laminas, cementó, madera e insumos agrícolas y la preparación de la tierra para hacer sus cultivos,  gracias al financiamiento le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia. 

Él quiere para su futuro construir su propia casa para vivir cómodamente con su familia en un lugar digno para ellos y también desea iniciar un negocio de una tienda que le genere ingresos económicos para su familia y para su hija desea lo mejor que sea una persona de bien en la sociedad y que logres estudiar mucho con la ayuda de él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Edgar is 31 years old, and studied only till high school, when his parents sent him to work on the land. Edgar is married, and his wife stays at home and looks after their 3-year old daughter. 

Edgar earns a living by driving people from one place to another in his own car. He has been doing this for four years now, since he first bought his vehicle. He learned this work from an uncle who taught him to drive, and then he bought his own vehicle. 

He also earns money through farming basic products (corn and beans). He has a lot of experience in this line of work as his father taught him to work the land. His wife helps him out on occasion, as needed. 

Edgar will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as sheet metal, cement and wood for his home, as well as agricultural supplies to prepare the land for planting crops. This loan will allow him and his family to enjoy a better quality of life. 

In the future, Edgar would like to build his own house in order to live comfortably with his family, and he would also like to set up his own shop to generate income for his family. He hopes that his daughter will grow up to be a valuable member of society, and that she will study a lot with her parents' help.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, cement, wood, and agricultural supplies to prepare the land for growing crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive en una comunidad del departamento de Jinotega, al norte de Nicaragua. Tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 4 años con su esposa. Desde hace 5 años, está dedicado al cultivo de café como principal actividad económica, a través de la cual también genera 1 empleo en su comunidad. Este emprendedor está integrado a los procesos de certificación de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, promovidos por la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).

Actualmente, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para el mantenimiento de sus 7 hectáreas de café, específicamente para garantizar la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes requeridos por su plantación, y asegurar de esta forma rendimientos mayores a 300 quintales de café pergamino en la próxima cosecha. Los ingresos generados por este rubro, son los que le permiten a este pequeño productor cubrir las necesidades de su familia y continuar invirtiendo para mejorar las condiciones de su finca. El está seguro que con su esfuerzo y trabajo podrá seguir incrementando su área de café para lo cual también realiza gestiones, a fin de garantizar la sostenibilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos de la Cruz lives in a community in the Jinotega Department in northern Nicaragua. With his wife he has two children of three and four years old. For the past five years he has worked growing coffee as his main source of income, through which he also generates a job in his community. This enterprising farmer has begun the certification processes for Fairtrade, UTZ Certified, and C.A.F.E. Practices statuses, as promoted by the Association for People in Community Action (PAC).

Carlos is currently seeking a loan to help him maintain and care for his seven hectares of coffee. In particular, it will guarantee that he is able to apply fertilisers and other inputs that his crops need, and so ensure yields of over 300 quintals (hundredweight) of parchment coffee at the next harvest. The income this will generate will allow this small farmer to meet the needs of his family and to continue to invest in improving his coffee plantation. He is sure that with his effort and hard work he will be able to keep increasing his coffee-growing area. This drives him to work hard on the administrative side of things too, with the aim of making his family's security certain.

loans.use: to care for his seven hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is 29 years old and has four children.  She is married and has three children who are currently in school. Aileen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Aileen has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en: Germelina is 62 years old and widowed with four children.  She works very hard to provide for them. Germelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, candies, shampoo, seasoning, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for one year, and sells a variety of items such those mentioned. In the future, Germelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, candies, shampoo, seasoning, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en: Noralyn is 34 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from food vending. Noralyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marciana requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marciana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is 57 years old and has nine children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Prudencia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Prudencia has been fattening pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Prudencia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Shirley Rosita

texts.en:
Ma. Shirley Rosita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Ma. Shirley Rosita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ma. Shirley Rosita has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 49 years old, married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her dressmaking. Lolita has been in this business for twenty-two years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to have her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her dressmaking.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 44 years old and has seven children. She is married and has five children who are currently in school. Vilma is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business. Vilma has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and hasf three children. She works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Josephine requested a loan from NWTF for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel, 48, is married and has six children, three of whom are in school. For the past 28 years she has worked hard operating an auto repair shop in the Philippines.

Mabel is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new equipment for her shop. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María de 74 años de edad, no estudio ningún grado académico no sabe leer ni escribir, debido a la situación económica en su hogar sus padres no le pudieron apoyar para su estudio, se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde pequeña se dedica a esta actividad que su madre le enseño comenta que se siente muy orgullosa al realizar esta actividad;  porque es un trabajo heredado por sus padres, es soltera tiene 4 hijos los cuales 3 de ellos residen en Estados Unidos, y en su casa habitan una hija, una nieta y una bisnieta, los cuales no dependen de ella, comenta que sus hijos le dan su sostenimiento gracias a las remesas que le envían. 


María se dedica a cuidar  a su nieta y bisnieta, además se dedica a los oficios domésticos compartidos con su hija, cometa que se siente muy bien al realizar esta actividad.

El crédito lo utilizara para reparar su vivienda debido al tiempo se le ha deteriorado y  específicamente para la construcción de un baño sanitario, comprara 300 bloques, 8 bolsas de cemento, 1 quintales de hierro, y para pagar la mano de obra, ella quiere vivir más cómodamente en su hogar y para estar mejor con su familia que habita la casa junto con ella.

María siempre ha querido reparar su casa, pero debido a los gastos económicos que requiere no lo había podido lograr, pero gracias al otorgamiento del crédito podrá realizar sus planes  y solicitar más créditos en un futuro y sobre todo que Dios le regale muchos años más de salud.
texts.en:
María is 74 years old. She did not study and cannot write or read. Her parents could not pay for her education because they did not have the money. She works as a housekeeper. Her mother taught her when she was a little girl. She says that she is proud of what she does, because she inherited this activity from her parents. She is single and has four children, three live in the United States. She lives with her daughter, a granddaughter and a great-granddaughter. She does not have to sustain them, and her children send her money from abroad.

María takes care of her granddaughter and her great-granddaughter. She also takes care of the household chores together with her granddaughter. She says that she likes doing this activity. She will use this loan to make some home improvements. With time, her house has deteriorated. She wants to build a bathroom so she needs to buy 300 bricks, eight bags of cement and one quintal of iron bars, and she will pay for the labor. She wants to live more comfortably at home, together with her family.

María has always wanted to repair her house, but she had not been able to do so because she lacked the money. However, thanks to this loan, she will be able to realize her plans and request more loans in the future. She hopes that God* gives her many more years in good health.

* Note from the translator: she probably means the Christian God.

loans.use: to buy 300 bricks, eight bags of cement and one quintal of iron bars, and to pay for the labor needed to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has three children who are in school. In order to earn a daily income she decided to sell cosmetics, perfumes and other beauty products around in her village.

Juliet is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy more perfume to sell. She hopes to satisfy her customers by being able to deliver their orders without delay. At present, her goal is to double her earnings because one of her children is about to enter college.

loans.use: to buy more perfume to sell.

loans.name: 12-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a service business, tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to tailor.

Hương is 40 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the 12-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to tailor.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina formerly worked abroad as a domestic helper for almost 14 years. When she came back home, she decided to run a sari-sari store business in their village. When she realized that her income was not enough to sustain her parents' needs, Adelina closed her business and started running a hog-raising business. Adelina is in her 60s and still single. She wanted to grow her business to continue to support her niece and nephews and be able to finish college. Adelina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed for her hogs. It will be a big help for her to maintain and grow the business for her niece and nephews' future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Makutano Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late 40s, is married with three kids who are still at school.  She has been selling soft drinks at wholesale prices for two years now.  She works from 2 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy soft drinks to sell at wholesale price.  She dreams of building her own house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Makutano", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 54 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Myrna has an egg-retailing business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of eggs to resell.

Myrna has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to resell.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en:
Romualda is 61 years old and married with three children. Romualda works very hard to provide for them.

Romualda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Romualda has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Romualda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Romualda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Martha
