Marcos se dedica a la carpintería el cual tiene 9 años de dedicarse a esta actividad , el cual lo aprendió de un amigo, ademas cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados  de maíz la cual lo hace los fines de semana o por las tardes.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar materiales para la  carpintería, como taladro, serrucho, clavos, barniz, madera, etc.  el cliente espera tener mejores ingresos  y una buenas condiciones de vida.

Marcos  sueña y proyecta construir su vivienda, mejorar y equipar su taller y sacar adelante su familia poder ver crecer sus y hijos y prepararlos académicamente, pero sabe que esto lo lograra gracias al crédito y espera que Dios le de vida y salud para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Marcos, who is 34, studied up to middle school, he is accompanied by his life partner who takes care of the housework at home. They have two children, who study, and they live in the same house as his parents who depend on him.
Marcos makes a living as a carpenter, having spent 9 years in this activity. He learned the trade from a friend. He also farms 7,000 square meters of corn on weekends and in the evenings.
The loan he is requesting is to purchase carpentry supplies such as a drill, a saw, nails, varnish, wood, etc. The client hopes to have better incomes and good living conditions.
Marcos dreams about and projects building his residence, improving and equipping his workshop, supporting his family and being able to see his children grow and prepare them academically. He knows he will achieve this thanks to the loan and hopes God gives him life and health to be able to achieve this.

loans.use: purchase carpentry supplies such as a drill, a saw, nails, varnish, wood, etc.

loans.name: Luís Ángel

texts.es:
Luis de 49 años de edad,  estudio hasta quinto grado, esta soltero, procede de una familia  muy humilde pero trabajadora, vive con su madre y un hermano, con quienes comparte casi todo su tiempo.


Él es agricultor, tiene más de 20 años de trabajar la tierra, si dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, cuando su padre lo llevaba al campo le fue enseñando todo sobre lo del trabajo de la agricultura, también cuida una ternera que es de su propiedad.  El trabajo lo tiene a pocos metros de su casa, por lo que no necesita un medio de transporte para viajar, el horario de su trabajo es de 6 am a 12 md.

El proyecto que realizara es comprar una vaca de repasto, para luego venderlo, y con esto genera un ingreso a su hogar, con lo que mejorara sus activos  y podrá ampliar la producción y tendrá más posibilidades para sus hijos que están estudiando.

Su deseo es cuidar de su madre ya que está bastante anciana, y el hermano que también vive con ellos, por lo que es el único que está cerca de ella para cuando necesita algo, el préstamo será utilizado en la compra de una ternera, ya cuenta con una y va pensando en ampliar más la producción, ya que en su momento serán vacas que den leche y con lo que sostendrán parte de su alimentación.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 49, studied up to 5th grade, is single and comes from a humble, yet hard-working family. He lives with his mother and one brother and spends almost all his time with them. He is a farmer, having spent more than 20 years working the land. He farms corn, beans and sorghum. When his father used to take him out to the field he taught him everything about agriculture, he also cares for a calf which he owns. His work is a few meters from his house so he does not need a form of transportation, his work schedule is from 6am to 12pm.
The project he will complete is the purchase of a grazing cow to eventually sell and with this generate an income for his home which will improve his assets and will be able to increase production and have more possibilities for his children who are studying.
His wish is to care for his mother, as she is quite old, and his brother, who also lives with them, and is the only one who is around when she needs something. The credit will be utilized for the purchase of the calf, he already has one and wants to increase production because in due time they will be cows who produce milk and be used to support part of their diet.

loans.use: purchase a grazing cow.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es: Gudelia de 46 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 13 años con este trabajo y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener los mejores resultados, su  negocio está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y frecuentada por las personas de la comunidad, es muy conocida pues sus tortillas son las más ricas y siempre están calientitas, tiene mucha clientela y la buscan por su excelente calidad, buenos precios y sobre todo el servicio más rápido; Gudelia  es una mujer luchadora, entregada a su labor, en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar su inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc. Gudelia tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de otras instituciones y se hace responsable del pago completo de la deuda, y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Gudelia, 46, lives with her husband and three children. She sells tortillas. She has been doing this work for 13 years. Her shop is strategically located in an area which is frequented by many people in the community. She is well-known as her tortillas are very good and always hot. She has many clients and they look for her excellent quality, good prices and above all quick service.
 
Gudelia is a determined woman, dedicated to her work. In the last few months there has been an increased in demand. She wants to take advantage to increase her investment but she doesn’t have enough capital and that is why she is requesting a loan with Integral. This loan will allow her to purchase corn at wholesale, propane gas etc...  She has good payment references with other institutions and is responsible for full debt payment. She hopes to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale, propane gas etc....

loans.name: Anabel María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
Aquí vive la señorita Anabel, tiene 30 años  de edad, está soltera  y  vive en casa de sus padres, junto a sus hermanos más pequeños. 
Doña Anabel en sociedad con un tío se dedican a la compra y venta de arroz, melones, sandias, pepinos y otros productos que se cultivan por la zona donde ella habita, ella también junto a su familia procesan sal en grano, la misma que luego venden a ganaderos de la zona los cuales la utilizan como alimento del ganado, también a pescadores de la zona,  en su casa cuentan con el lugar apropiado para procesar este mineral que le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, melones y sandias. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener un camión más grande para llevar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo village there is a place known as Los Arenales. The members of the communal bank Miraflores meet here every fifteen days. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

Anabel, 30 years old and single, lives here in her parents' home together with her younger siblings. In partnership with an uncle, she earns a living buying and selling rice, cantaloupe, watermelon, cucumbers and other produce cultivated in the area where she lives. She also works with her family on processing rock salt. This is then sold to cattle ranchers in the area who use it to nourish their cattle and also to fisherman in the area. They have a suitable place in their home to process this mineral which earns her a very good income. 

She is going to use this new loan to buy rice, cantaloupe and watermelon. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are quick and without many requirements. Her dream is to own a larger truck so that she can bring her products to other cities.

loans.use: to buy rice, cantaloupe and watermelon.

loans.name: Los Primos Group

texts.es: Delmer, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos y reside junto a sus hijos y su madre en el sector Cofradía, Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Toda su vida la a dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, frijoles, café y chile. Esta producción es vendida en la misma zona. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo en forma grupal por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para dar mantenimiento a la finca de café y siembra de nuevas plantas de café. El considera que le ayudara a mejorar su producción. Su plan es sacar café de primera calidad y poder crecer económicamente para que sus hijos tengan buena educación. El grupo se llama Los Primos esta formado por 5 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura,viven en la misma comunidad, el monto total del grupo es de 43,000 lempiras y lo utilizaran para fertilizar la finca de café. En la foto a la izquierda esta Jose Manuel,Delmer,Trinilo,Jose y Juan a la derecha con camisa negra.
texts.en:
Delmer is 30 years old, single, has two children and lives together with them and his mother in the Cofradía sector of the San Pedro Sula municipality. He has worked in agriculture his whole life: he grows corn, beans, coffee, and chile peppers. The produce is sold in the same area. 

He has decided to request a loan with the group, for 10,000 HNL to buy fertilizers and composts to maintain the coffee plantation and plant new coffee plants. He believes this will help him to improve his production. His plan is to produce first-quality coffee and to be able to grow economically so his children can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and composts to maintain the coffee plantation and plant new coffee plants

loans.name: Hondomsang Lom Group

texts.en:
In spring and summer, these five like-minded women formed a group called “Hondomsang Lom”, which means “Up-lifter group”. Like the group name, they motivate and support one another financially and economically and try to supplement their families’ income. They all live in Churachandpur, which is one of the districts of Manipur, in the northeastern part of India.

Chingsuanniang is the profiled member pictured with her hand raised. She is 27 years old and a mother to two kids. Her eldest daughter is studying in primary class, whereas the younger one is only 7 months old. Her husband is a carpenter by profession and earns some income. However, his income is not sufficient to manage the family. 

In order to supplement the family income, with the help of her husband’s meager income, she managed to open a small shop on a small budget. In her shop she sells paan, cigarettes, fruit juice and the like, and a few eatables like chips. 

She needs a loan to continue with her selling activities. She will use the loan to increase her store stock to sell. She wishes to use the loan to extend her store to room size. With part of the loan, she will stock the store with shampoo (sachet), fruit juice, biscuits, turmeric powder, ginger, chili, potatoes and daily items, and sell them at a profit. Her husband helps in managing the store in her absence. She is very happy with her husband's helping nature. 

She has been saving, and in the future, she plans to purchase a plot of land rather than paying the rent for the room. Likewise, the rest of the group members need this loan to do better with their income-generating undertakings. The members’ activities are paan shop, vegetable vendor and weaving traditional clothes respectively, according to their earning convenience.

loans.use: to buy items like cold drinks, fruit juice, chips, biscuits, etc. for the variety store.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, вдова, 7 детей. Образование у Бактыгул среднее, она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1990 году. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в хозяйстве имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 5 овец, 5 коз и 1 лошадь. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, мяса и скота, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также в будущем хочет женить сына.
texts.en: Baktygul is 51 years old, a widow, with seven children. She has secondary education. Baktygul is a calm, even-tempered and hard-working person. Her children help her in the business. As an additional source of income for her family, Baktygul has been raising livestock for many years, having launched this business in 1990. Thanks to Baktygul’s hard work, her farm now includes four dairy cows, five sheep, five goats and one horse. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS from selling milk, dairy products, meat and livestock. This income serves  as a basis for covering the costs of food  and everyday needs for her family. In order to develop her business further, Baktygul turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 15,000 KGS to buy sheep. Baktygul plans to use the resulting income for an additional livestock increase. Also in the future she would like to pay for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Denalyn

texts.en: Denalyn, 33 years old, is married with seven children. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for eight years. Denalyn is a very hardworking person. She makes sure that she can fill all the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs to make additional income. Denalyn hopes that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tausi Group

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her late 30s, is married with seven kids. Five of them are at school and two of them are still small. She has been selling kitchen utensils for one year now. She works from 10 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Lucy's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the stock of the utensils and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is really doing fine and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date kitchen utensils and to start selling plastic shoes. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group "Tausi" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date kitchen utensils and to start selling plastic shoes.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob lives in the Syunik region, in the village of Tandzaver. Hakob lives with his retired wife and both of them are engaged in farming and agriculture.  Hakob used to work as a driver, then as a forester, but now he is unemployed and fully busy with farming. 

On his farm, Hakob breeds two cows, two calves, a heifer, three horses, and 25 chickens. On his land, he cultivates mainly fruit, which he sells to resellers, from his house. Hakob says that it is very hard for him and very expensive to rent a car each time to go to the city wholesale market to sell his farm products there. That is why he sells all that he organizes, right from his house.

Hakob asks for this loan in order to buy a truck that will be of great use to him and will reduce the costs of the transfer of his farm products from the village to the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 48 years of age, is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. She always saves her income for future emergencies. Due to insufficient capital for her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase curls, biscuits, candies, beverages, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase curls, biscuits, candies, beverages, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: M. Asghar

texts.en: M. Asghar is a 47-year-old married and energetic man living with his spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a business making new spare parts and dies. He has been running this business for the last twenty years. His shop is situated in the market and it is challenging for him to sell his products with his competitors. He owns a lathe machine by which he makes different types of dies and spare parts. Due to excess use it requires some maintenance. Moreover, he wants to increase his current business as well. To grow his business and income and abstain from the competitors he decided to offer some additional and stylish spare parts. M. Asghar hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will be attracted towards his new products. Therefore he is in need of some new tools, cast iron, etc. However, he cannot act upon his strategy without some capital, so he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because BRAC Pakistan provides the facility to empower the poor. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and cast iron for making new spare parts and dies.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia, aged 39, is married to a bus driver and they're blessed with three children. She has been in the hog raising business for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 per hog. Her net profits of her business are usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to financial insufficiency she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik lives in the village of Chapni in the Syunik region. He is married and has two sons and a daughter. Until 2004 he was employed and he worked as a worker at a workshop, but now he is unemployed and greatly busy with farming and agriculture. Yurik’s wife now is in the Russian Federation and Yurik has a lot of duties with his family and the most important among them is the care of his children. They are still school-aged, but all of them support their father in farming and care about their house. Yurik has a small farm where he breeds two cows and ten chickens. He sells milk and eggs to his neighbors and also honey. He has 30 bee hives which give perfect and pure honey.

Yurik is asking for this loan since he needs to buy some more bee hives, several frames of waxed paper and with the rest of the loan he will purchase diesel fuel for his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy some more bee hives, several frames of waxed paper and to purchase diesel fuel for his agricultural activities

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman is 36 years old, married with a daughter and a son. Her husband is a master and repairs furniture and household appliances and earns money for the family this way. But the main source of income for the family is animal husbandry. Khuraman has been working in this area for 12 years and has good experience. She raises, fattens and then resells livestock for a good price at a local bazaar and her monthly income is 400 AZN.

Animal husbandry is very widespread in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for milk and meat. Local restaurants get their supply of meat for national dishes from Khuraman’s farm and they are very satisfied with the products.

Khuraman’s income doesn’t cover the family’s demands. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to build a new cow stable and improve the farm’s conditions and productivity.

loans.use: to build a new cow stable

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
Dorcy previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like thread, cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dorcy dreams of having other sources of income and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga works in agriculture farming food. She is 44 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water filter system.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water filter system

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel is married and has three children she is sending to school. Her children are between college and elementary levels of education. With the desire of her husband to give them a better way of living, he decided to work abroad. Anabel wants to help her husband carrying their family needs and expenditures even in a simple way. She chose to manage the selling of snack foods and street foods in the market. Anabel dreams of having a sari-sari store business too in their house so that even if she is in their house she has a source of income. In this connection, Anabel is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy raw materials and ingredients for her business. She also plans to use some of her loan to start her dream business which is a sari-sari store. Anabel will prioritize her children's education out of her income from the business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Amelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Amelia, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 15 y 3  años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Amelia es una muy buena ama de casa le gusta trabajar para ganar algo por su cuenta y con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en la cual  se dedica a  preparar y vender comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, hot dog, papas fritas, batidos de frutas, jugos y sodas, trabaja  todas las tardes y noches con la ayuda de su marido, llevan más de 3 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por el bien familiar.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, pan, salchichas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 3 años en el grupo de crédito el mismo tiempo que su negocio para lo cual empleo su primer crédito. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
There is a place known as Las Arenales in the Crucita parrish in the Portoviejo canton.  The members of the Miraflores communal bank meet there every 15 days.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

This is the place where Amelia, age 36, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have two children, ages 15 and 3.  The older child goes to school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Amelia is a very good housewife.  She likes to work in order to earn something on her own.  With her earnings she helps her husband with the expenses generated by the household and with the children’s education.

She has a small place at her house where she prepares and sells fast food like hamburgers, hot dogs, French fries, fruit smoothies, juices, and sodas.  She works every afternoon and evening with the help of her husband.  They have been in this business for over three years.  The business allows her to earn something for the family’s well-being.

She will use this loan to buy cooking oil, bread, sausages, and other provisions to prepare the food.  She has been in the communal bank for three years.  This is the same amount of time she has had her business, which she used her first loan for.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bread, sausages, and other provisions to prepare the food.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Meliza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making and selling bags. Meliza is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Meliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Mary Grace requested a PHP 3000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Mary Grace has been in this business for three years now. With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mừng

texts.en:
Mừng, 51 years old, has worked in agriculture, farming food, for more than 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. Mừng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mừng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Mừng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. With her business profit, Mừng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel internationally for a vacation.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a  latrine/toilet

loans.name: Luyến

texts.en:
Luyến, 32 years, old, has worked in agriculture, farming food, for more than 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. Luyến supports 3 dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Luyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Luyến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. With her business profit, Luyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to graduate from college, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine/toilet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, maize flour, baking flour, Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal  for cooking

loans.name: Búp

texts.en:
Búp, 58 years old, has worked in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, for more than 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. Búp lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Búp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Búp faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to repair the toilet. In the future, Búp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to repair the latrine/toilet

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Mãe solteira de 3 filhos, todos na sua responsabilidade e 1 encontra-se num centro de formação profissional em Gaza, tem 46 anos de idade, vive na casa própria à base de negocio que faz numa barraca dentro do mercado todos os  dias.
Com o crédito pretende comprar bebidas( refrescos, vinhos, cervejas e sumos), frangos, carne para fazer refeições e revender na sua barraca.
O seu sonho é de poder aumentar os seus bens.
Seu maior desafio é a concorrência no negocio e o mercado não ajuda, pois tem poucos clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother of three. All her children are under her care and one of them is in a vocational training centre in Gaza. She's 46 years old and lives in a house that she owns. She earns a livelihood through the business that she runs in a booth at the market on a daily basis.
With the loan she intends to purchase beverages (refreshments, wine, beer and juice), chicken and meat in order to prepare meals and sell them at her booth.
Her dream is to increase her assets.
Her biggest challenge is the competition in the business, and the market doesn't help, since it doesn't get many customers.

loans.use: to purchase beverages (refreshments, wine, beer and juice), chicken and meat in order to prepare meals and sell them at her booth.

loans.name: Lucrecia Amanda

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Lucrecia, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo ya no trabaja por la edad.
Doña Lucrecia es una mujer que toda la vida le ha gustado ganar algo por su cuenta, es así que desde hace mas de 30 años surtió una tienda de víveres en su casa que empezó con poco pero con el paso de los días ella ha logrado surtir muy bien su local, allí vende de todo un poco desde granos, detergentes, embutidos, legumbres, carnes entre otras cosas de primera necesidad así como también artículos de bazar, papelería y ciertas medicinas, trabaja con la ayuda de su marido ya que el está jubilado. Así ella siempre se gano sus ingresos con los cueles les dio una buena educación a sus hijos y ahora que ellos son profesionales les permite salir adelante con su marido. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace varios años y le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the cantón of Portoviejo, there is a place known as Los Arenales. Every fifteen days, the members of the communal bank group “Miraflores” meets here. This place is known for its beautiful beaches and for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Lucrecia lives in this place. She is 55 years old, married, and has 6 children who are of age and live independently. Her husband no longer works due to his age.

Lucrecia is a person who, during her whole life, has liked to make some of her own money. This is why, over 30 years ago, she started to stock a grocery store in her house. She started out with very little, but over time she has stocked her store very well. She sells a little of everything, from grains, detergents, lunch meats, vegetables, and meats, among other items of basic need, such as gift items, stationary, and certain medicines. She works with the help of her husband since he is retired. In this way she always earned her own income, with which she gave her children a good education. Now that they are professionals, the income allows her to get ahead in life, along with her husband.

She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, lunch meats, and other products of basic need. She has been in the communal bank group for several years and she likes it because of the helpful loans. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, lunch meats, and other products of basic need.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more lappa (fabric), blouses, jeans, and chin for her business.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh, 45 years old, has worked in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, for more than 10 years. She is married and has 2 children. Vinh lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Vinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Vinh faces in her life is not having a latrine; her family shares the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine/toilet

loans.name: Tuyến

texts.en:
Tuyến operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Tuyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tuyến is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children.

This is Tuyến first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Tuyến faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family shares the neighbor's latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tuyến hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Giảng

texts.en:
Giảng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Giảng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. He lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Giảng is 59 years old and he is married with 3 children.

This is Giảng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main harship that Giảng faces in his life is not having hygeinic latrine.He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Giảng hopes to remodel his house, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia, 28 years old, is married and the mother of three. For the last two years, she has sold eggs to earn a living. Her business is located in Narok and she earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

Cynthia has borrowed a first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase eggs in bulk for the business. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. Cynthia's dream is to improve her living standards and to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for resale

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Solo una persona de gran corazón sería capaz de sacrificar su futuro, postergar sus metas con tal de ayudar a sus familiares, esta es la historia de Carolina una joven de tan solo 19 años de edad que vive sola con su madre y que mortificada por las necesidades que pasaban en su hogar y ver los enormes sacrificios que hacia su madre para llevar la comida de cada día, decidió montar su negocio de comidas rápidas y quizás era el más adecuado pues su familia siempre ha estado relacionada con las comidas y de hay aprendió el arte del oficio, vende productos como perros calientes, hamburguesas, arepas, chuzos, carnes asadas su principal sueño es poder ayudarle en todo lo posible a su madre que ambas salgan adelante por esto solicita su primer microcrédito para la compra de insumos al x mayor, para que el margen de ganancia sea más amplio, y lograr montar un local de ventas de comidas atendido por ella y su madre prosperando y sacando un negocio familiar juntas y con el pasar de los años tener una estabilidad económica que le permita estudiar una carrera universitaria
texts.en:
Only a person with a big heart would sacrifice her future and postpone her goals in order to help her family. This is the story of Carolina, a young woman just 19 years old who lives alone with her mother. Worried about the unmet needs in her household, and seeing the enormous sacrifices that her mother made in order to bring food home each day, she decided to start her own fast food business. This was the best option because her family has always worked with food and that’s where she learned the art of the business. She sells foods such as hot dogs, hamburgers, arepas [a type of filled corn cake, similar to a sandwich], meat shish kebabs, and roasted meats. Her dream is to be able to help her mother as much as possible and that both of them will be able to get ahead in life. 

She is requesting her first microloan in order to buy ingredients at wholesale price, so that her profit margin will be larger. She also wants to open a store tended by herself and her mother, where they can prosper and get ahead with a family business together. Eventually she wants to have economic stability such that she could study at university.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale price, such as cheeses, meats, breads, bags and boxes for packaging, silverware, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Betzy Elizabeth

texts.es: Betzy Una mujer de 26 años de edad madre de un hijo de un año al cual le ha dedicado los mejores años de su vida trabajando arduamente para que a este nunca le llegue a faltar nada como madre responsable que es, junto con su madre tienen un negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios como aretes, reloj, diademas, hebillas entre otras cosas actividad que inicio en el colegio donde le ofrecía productos a su compañeras para tener su propio capital y fue perfeccionando con ayuda de su madre, sus productos los comercializan principalmente a vecinos del sector y familiares claro que también a personas comunes que se acercan a preguntar por sus productos. Betzy junto con su madre tienen un gran proyecto en mano y es montar un segundo punto de distribución por lo que requieren un crédito para la compra de vitrinas, estanterías y surtido en general con los que esperan aumentar sus ingresos para ayudarse con los gastos familiares y escolares de su pequeña niña, su principal sueño es tener un local amplio con mucha variedad que sea tan llamativo que atraiga clientes de diferentes sectores de la ciudad y porque no de otras ciudades convirtiéndose en un icono comercial en la venta de ropa y accesorios para hombre y dama
texts.en: Betzy is a 26 year old mother of a 1 year old child to whom she has dedicated the best years of her life working hard so that he never lacks for anything, responsible mother that she is. Together with her mother they have a business selling clothing and accessories such as earrings, watches, headbands, belt buckles, and other items. She began this business while in school, selling products to her friends so she could have her own money. She continued perfecting her business with the help of her mother. She primarily sells to neighbors in her area and acquaintances and of course to people who seek out her products.  Betzy and her mother have a large imminent project to open a second location, which requires a loan to buy display cases, stands, and stock with which they hope to increase their income to help with their family and school expenses of her little girl. Her main dream is to have a big locale with a lot of variety that will be appealing and attract customers from different parts of the city and why not even other cities, thus becoming an iconic business known for selling clothing and accessories for men and women.

loans.use: to buy display cases, stands, and stock to open a second location for her business.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran, aged 54 years, resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has twelve children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, Ran and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day to meet their needs. 

Ran has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles already. She successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and to continue her children’s education. Now she and her group members are applying for a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Ran is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Manjuma

texts.en:
Manjuma is 30 years old and married.  She is from the remote village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both are uneducated and can only sign their names.  They have three children, two of whom are students in grades 6 and 4, respectively, and the other is too young for school. They live in a small village in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw).

Manjuma's husband has a small business. The income from the business is hardly enough to cover the household.  So to help her husband, she decided to take control of her household and to take responsibility for the finances. So she started her own animal husbandry business three years back.   She is now the main breadwinner of the family.  She is an energetic, hardworking lady.  With her dedication, she has improved her business.  She has one cow and one buffalo. She supplies milk to the neighbors who are her main clients.

In order to improve her business and to have financial stability, she has decided to purchase one more cow to start the business of milk products (curd, butter, cheese).  So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She hopes it will increase her earnings and give good support to her family's economy and at the same time, give a better education to her children.

She aspires to build a concrete-made house for them.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a milk supply business .

loans.name: Hok's Group

texts.en:
Hok, 59 years old, is originally from a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a married mother of five children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 22 years and, to better support the family and help to earn more income, Hok's husband works as a paid laborer. Together, Hok and her husband earn about 54,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and they manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Hok has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid her past loans. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Hok will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Edith Del Pilar

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa pero ya está casada y vive con su esposo y una linda bebé. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Edith con esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende de todo un poco desde granos, detergentes, embutidos, legumbres, cranes entre otras cosas de primera necesidad así como también artículos de bazar, papelería, helados,   entre otros productos, este negocio lo comenzaron con muy poco hace 4 años tiempo en el cual cada vez lo han ido mejorando y está bien surtido para el servicio d los clientes que a diario llegan hasta su local a comprar víveres, esto también con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido ya que con ellos ella mejora su negocio. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde el inicio y le gusta porque con la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the area of 26th of September street in Portoviejo city, known as the Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, every 15 days members of the 24 of September Group meets. In this place lives 55 year old Edith. She is married and has 6 grown children. One married daughter lives with her along with her husband and beautiful baby daughter. Her husband is a businessman. Edith and her husband are business people, they also have a store of household goods in their home where they sell a little bit of everything from grains, detergents, canned goods, vegetables and other basic needs items to things like office supplies, ice cream and other products. They began this business 4 years ago with very little, and have been growing the business. It is well stocked to serve customer who daily arrive to their location to buy goods. With the help of loans that she has received she has expanded her business.

This loan is going to be used to stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods and other basic needs products. She has been involved with her Grupo De Crédito since its beginning and she likes it for the help the loans provide. Her dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods and other basic needs items.

loans.name: Maryuri Alicia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Miraflores, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3  hijos de 22, 19 y 16  años de edad, dos de ellos estudian en universidad y colegio y son los que aun viven con ella.
Doña Maryuri es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y con el esfuerzo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado,  junto a su hija se desplazan a las playas de la localidad a comprar el mejor pescado para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que a diario le comprar o también salen a entregar en ciertos restaurantes de la zona ya que ellas le venden buen pescado y limpio, llevan más 5 años con este negocio con el cual ella saca adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque dan los créditos rápidamente y los intereses son bajos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the town of Crucita in the Portoviejo region there is a place known as the dunes, where every 15 days the members of the Crédito Miraflores group meets. This place is known for is beautiful beaches, food, and warmth of its people.

In this place 39 year old Maryuri lives. She is a single mother and has three children ages 22, 19 and 16, two study in school and stil live with her. She is a woman who has always like to work and with her efforts has successfully raised her children. She buys and sells fish, working with her daughter at the local beaches to buy the best fish to then sell to customers who daily buy from her and they also deliver to certain area restaurants as it is known that they sell good clean fish. They have had this business for 5 years, and she has used it so support her family.

This loan is to buy fish. She has been a member of the group since it started, and she likes it because they give loans quickly and the interest rates are low. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Didima Cleopatra

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora Didima, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4  hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun viven con ella.
Doña Didima con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta para salir adelante ella sola se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa interior, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, en la temporada de inicio de clases es cuando más vende ya que los niños  requieren de este tipo de prendas para el inicio a clases y es por esta razón que necesita el crédito, ella inicio este negocio hace 4 años con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que gracias  a esto ella se gana la vida.  
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
In the 26th of September street area of Portoviejo city known as the Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, every 15 days the members of the Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre meets.

60 year old Didima lives here. She is the single mother of 4 grown children, once of whom still lives with her. Didima wanted to earn her own money to support herself so she has a business selling undergarments. She sells door to door and also sells from her home where her customers come when they need particular items. Back to school season is the time when she sells the most which is why she is seeking this loan. She began this business 4 years ago with the first loan that she received from the group, for which she is very grateful because thanks to that loan she earns her living.

This loan is going to be used to buy underwear. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 4 years and she like the group because it was the first loan that started her business. Her dreams are to have a locale in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Subarna

texts.en:
Subarna is married and has two children (one son and one daughter), who are students in grades 8 and 10. She lives in Shalbari in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Ananto and her children. They both are uneducated and could not get an elementary education due to their parents' poor financial resources.  They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).

Subarna's husband is a farmer who works from dawn to dusk on his own farmland and grows different kinds of vegetables. He learned the skills from his father and now puts them into practice.  Subarna, though a housewife, helps her husband in his work, especially at harvest time.  But yet they are still unable to give financial stability to their family.

To improve their agribusiness and to cultivate jute on their farmland, Subarna has taken a loan from BJS, (who gives loans to the rural women to start new business).  She has chosen this crop as it is in great demand in the present market and it is profitable, too.  So she hopes it will be a lucrative business that will ensure a good profit for her.  Thus the family will overcome their financial hurdles.

Subarna aspires to develop the business. She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a stable for his animals.

loans.name: Sahirun

texts.en:
Sahirun is a very young housewife from the village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives there with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  Her husband, 26 years old, is a farmer. Sahirun attended school up to grade 6, whereas her husband received an education up to grade 11.  One of her children reads in grade one and the other is below school-going age.

Sahirun's husband runs an agribusiness. He is totally involved in cultivation of potato, cabbage, tomatoes and different green vegetables. He is a hardworking man and loves his work. Sahirun also helps her husband in his work in different ways, especially at the time of harvesting, after managing her household work.  As it is the only source of income for the family, they devote most of the time in this business.

With the goal of further developing their business, Sahirun applied for financial support from BJS (Kiva's partner). They have decided to start cultivation of jute, which is a very profitable crop.  Sahirun has decided to use the loan to purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She intends to have a good harvest that will contribute toward a higher income. 
  
She gives her thanks to Kiva and BJS both.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariela Rocio

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 5  y 3  años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio, los siguientes en escuela e inicial. El marido es maestro.
Doña Mariela es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo ganar sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella tiene un negocio en su casa donde vende helados de una marca muy reconocida, además de agua en bidón y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito lo que es productos Avon y cobra semanalmente, ella lleva dos años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, helados y agua en bidón. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the 26th of September street area in Portoviejo city, an area known as Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, every 15 days the members of the Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre meet. 29 year old Mariela lives here, is married, with her three children ages 12, 5, and 3. The children are in school and preschool. Her husband is a teachers. Mariela is a woman who likes to be useful and with her efforts earn her own income for her family's benefit. She has a business in her house where she sells a well-known brand of ice cream, water in large drums, and Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She works every day, leaving on credit the Avon products and collecting weekly. She has been working this business for 2 years with which she earns money to help support her family.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, ice cream, and large drums of water. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 3 years and she likes it for the help it provides through the loans. Her dreams are that her children finish their schooling and be productive professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, ice creams, and large drums of water.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive don Diego, tiene 30 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposa trabaja en un centro comercial de la localidad.
El señor Diego trabaja de guardia de seguridad  en una institución del gobierno pero  en sus ratos libres se dedica al comercio, el vende ropa de todo tipo y sabanas para lo cual recorre la ciudad en una moto que tiene, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 2 años con este negocio con el cual se gana algo extra que le sirve para sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y sabanas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of this communal bank meet in the area on September 26, every two weeks, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Ecuador, which is known as the City of the True Tamarinds.

Diego, 30, lives here. He is married and has two children ages 11 and 6. They are both in school. His wife works at a store in town.

Diego works as a security guard at a government institution. In his free time, he works in commerce, selling all types of clothes and sheets. He does so by going throughout the city on his motorcycle. He sells on credit and collects it once a week. He has had this business for two years, with which he earns some extra money. This income helps his family move forward.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and sheets. He has been in this group for six loan cycles and he likes the help they provide with loans. He dream is to give his family the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sheets.

loans.name: Fe Esperanza

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito 24 de Septiembre. 
En este lugar vive la señora Fe, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, una hija casada vive en su casa. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Fe es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella también prepara comida, ya sea almuerzos o meriendas pero solo por pedidos, entregara a domicilio o en lugares de trabajo de los clientes, también trabaja en un centro recreacional en Manta donde gana un sueldo mensual por su trabajo lo cual le permite también ganarse algo extra por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su propio centro recreacional.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Calle 26 de Septiembre in the city of Portoviejo, every 15 days the members of the Group de Credito 24 de Septiembre meet. The city is the capital of the Manabi province and is also known as the Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos.

In this place lives Fe, 62, who is married and has four adult children. One of her married daughters lives with her and her husband who is a mason.
Fe takes care of her home but to gain her own income and therefore help her husband with the household costs, she also sells catalog ordered clothes and Yanbal products (beauty, cosmetic and perfume products and accessories for women). She also prepares food, whether it be lunch or afternoon snacks, by order only and she delivers the food to the work places of her customers. She also works in a recreational center in Manta where she gains a monthly wage for her work. This work also helps her gain some extra money for the well-being of her family.

This loan request is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes and ingredients to prepare the meals. She has been a member of Grupo De Credito since its beginning and she likes it because of the help the group provides with its loans. Her dream is to have her own recreational center.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes and food supplies.

loans.name: Su Bankito  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela La California  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del  Grupo De Crédito Su Bankito. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellos hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho en sus negocios y en su vida familiar.
Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Monserrate, tiene 53 años de edad está divorciada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 31, 18 y 14 años de edad, los menores  estudian en universidad y colegio.  Todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Monserrate es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto afrontar los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta ropa, ella también prepara comida para entregar, son muchas las personas que le piden y ella con mucho gusto les prepara los platos que ellos desean y una vez preparados los envía a domicilio o en sus lugares de trabajo, en cuanto a la venta de ropa su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, su mercadería se vende muy rápido ya que le envían desde los Estados Unidos por lo cual sus clientes cuando llega mercadería nueva la visitan, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio con el cual saca adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y víveres para preparar los platos. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the citadel of La California of the city of Portovieho, the members of the loan group "Su Bankito" meet every two weeks. These same people work in various businesses such as commerce in general and supplying services, among other things. Some time ago they decided to unite and form this loan group, which has helped them a lot in their businesses and in their family lives.

One of the members of this group is Señora Monserrate. She is 53 years old. She is divorced, and from her marriage she has three children, ages 31, 18, and 14. The youngest study at the university and in secondary school. All her children still live in her house.

Doña Monserrate is a housewife who sells clothing in order to obtain her own resources and with them to confront the household expenses and the school expenses of her children. She also prepares food tor delivery. There are many people who order it, and with great pleasure she prepares the dishes that they want. Once they are prepared, she sends them to their homes or workplaces. With regard to the clothing sales, her form of sales is door to door. Her merchandise sells very quickly, since they send it to her from the United States. For this reason, her customers visit her when new merchandise arrives. She has been in this business for 10 years, and with it she is raising her children.

This loan is to buy clothing and groceries to prepare her dishes. She has been in the loan group almost from its beginning, and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

The small photo is of a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and groceries to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes  está casada y tiene un hijo, ella tiene una mercería - librería en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano.
Comenta que se dedica a esta actividad hace 7 años y gracias al trabajo que realiza va creciendo su negocio, ayuda a su esposo con los gastos y también da a su hijo una vida digna.
Ella  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra vaqueros, camisas, calzado deportivo ya que llega el invierno y debe de surtir el negocio de mercería. Lourdes sueña con agrandar el negocio y dar fuente de trabajo  a las personas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is married and has a child. She has a dry goods store/bookstore, in which she works every day from the early hours of the day.

She says that she has been doing this work for seven years and that thanks to the work she does, her business is growing, she is helping her husband with the expenses, and she is giving her child a decent life.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase jeans, shirts, and sport shoes, since winter is coming and she has to restock her dry goods store. Lourdes dreams of expanding her business and giving others work.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, sport shoes, etc

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo muy luchador, que gracias al trabajo de todas están creciendo y saliendo adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucia, quien aparte es presidenta de este grupo.
Ella siempre motiva a sus compañeras a poder crecer y luchar como lo vienen haciendo. Lucia tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta ya muy tarde, es muy luchadora y se esmera por dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Su sueño es poder crecer en su negocio y el día de mañana tener un negocio mas amplio.
Lucia quiere comprar bebidas, lácteos, verduras, panificados y demás, y de esa forma poder surtir su negocio para poder dar a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This is a very determined group. Thanks to their work, they are growing and getting ahead in life. One of the members is Lucia, who is the president of this group.

She always motivates her fellow group members to grow and fight, as they have been doing. Lucia has a general store, where she works every day from very early until very late. She is very determined and goes to a lot of effort to give her family everything she was not able to have. Her dream is to be able to grow in her business and, in the future, to have a larger business.

Lucia wants to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables, bread products, and other products so she can restock her business in order to give her clients everything they need. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and that it will give her a lot of help.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables, bread products, and other products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
Artesanas  está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas y por medio de las capacitaciones están mejorando sus niveles de pobreza.
Sandra, es parte de este grupo, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, a través de la venta de prendas variadas que ella hace de manera ambulante y con lo cual viene ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, y por sobre todo trabajadora, con muchas ansias de trabajar y salir adelante.
La Sra. Sandra solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas de invierno variadas, ya que por medio de ello podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Artesanas" group is in their 5th cycle of the Woman's Committee Program where they are all working and helping each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey where thanks to the work of all the group and through their training sessions they are improving their economic levels.

Sandra is one member. She finds herself improving her situation of poverty through the sales of various clothing which she sells door-to-door. She can help her family and loved ones doing this. She is very much a fighter and moreover a hard-worker with a yearning to work and progress. Sandra is requesting a loan to buy a variety of winter clothing, as by doing this she can continue her sales and strive to improve the conditions of her life. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving and it will be very useful for her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of winter clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Kuera Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kuera Katupyry está en su ciclo 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias a este y sumado a las capacitaciones están mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Demesia, ella  se dedica a  la venta de ropas,  tiene una buena clientela formada, en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada invirtiendo el dinero del préstamo que realiza dentro del comité, lo que le ayuda a invertir en su venta de ropas y a seguir mejorando sus ingresos y el de su familia 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar más variedad de prendas, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le ayudará a seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Kuera Katupyry" is in its 10th lending cycle with the women's committee program.  The members are participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" program where, thanks to the poverty survey and the trainings, they are improving their standards of living. 
One of the members is Sra. Demesia.  She makes her living selling clothing.  She has a well-established clientele, and in her most recent poverty survey was above the poverty line.  Just the same, she is still very enthusiastic about investing the loan from the committee.  It helps her invest in her clothing sales business and improve her family's income. 
Sra. Demesia is asking for this loan to purchase a greater variety of garments for her business so she can keep on with her business and continue working hard, as she is doing now.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, which will allow her to continue the work she is now doing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of garments for re-sale.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun is 38 years old and widowed. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has four dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 15 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 25,700 KHR per day to support her family’s need.
 
This is the ninth micro loan for Noun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan. Noun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so she can earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom, 26, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is widowed with three children and they are still too small for school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for several years. The current business earns her family about 44,000 KHR per day.

Sreymom has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income and better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: M. Ishfaq

texts.en:
M. Ishfaq is a 38-year-old married father of three children. He is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. M. Ishfaq owns a clothes shop in the market; he sales fancy and high quality clothes. Some customers prove very poor and they do not purchase after asking rates. He does not compromise upon his quality and rates and does not sell below his purchasing power but he does not like to refuse his respected customers also. To win their confidence and to avoid from refusal; he wants to start a low rates clothing stall on the front of his shop. So that, such customers who do not have enough purchasing power could buy clothes easily. 

M. Ishfaq invests his savings and profit in his current business but does not have enough amount to start for new business. For this purpose he wants financial help from Kiva. Therefore he contacted the field partner BRAC Pakistan, who is the medium between Kiva and the borrowers. M. Ishfaq is very delighted and thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new veriety clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Las Triunfadoras están en el 6to. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde se están esforzando por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, ella  se dedica a la venta de comidas en su casa y también trae productos comestibles de la ciudad de Posadas para volver a vender,  tiene una buena clientela formada, y en su última encuesta se encontraba mejorando su vida por medio de su trabajo, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
Liz pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás. Es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, que le permitirá ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Triunfadoras" (The Triumphant Ones) is in its 6th lending cycle with the women's committee program.  The members are all participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" program, where they are working hard to get ahead and help their families.  
One of the members is Sra. Liz.  She makes her living selling food from her home.  She also brings food items from the city of Posadas to re-sell.  She has a well-formed clientele.  In her most recent poverty elimination survey, she found that through her work, her situation is improving.  Just the same, she is still very enthusiastic about working hard to improve her life and that of her family. 
It is also worth mentioning the work of the advisers.  They offer constant monitoring of the trainings and verifications. 
Liz is asking for this loan to purchase various supplies so she can keep making her food.  She will purchase vegetables, meats, condiments and other items.  Liz is very dedicated to her work, which allows her to help her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meats, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Guarambare Group

texts.es:
El Comité de nombre Guarambare son 15 señoras que tienen diversas actividades comerciales, cada una lucha por poder mejorar sus vidas por medio de las capacitaciones que van recibiendo.
Claudia es vendedora de ropas usadas, y comenta que gracias a este trabajo ayuda a su familia. En su venta de ropas usadas le está yendo muy bien, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad y a bajo costo y es eso lo que la ayuda a poder ir teniendo mejores ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas usadas para la venta, ya que así podrá surtirse y tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Guarambare" is made up of 15 women who have diverse businesses.  Each woman is working hard to improve her life through the trainings their communal bank is receiving. 
Claudia sells used clothing.  She says that thanks to her work, she is helping her family.  Her used-clothing sales are going very well.  She always has a nice variety of garments at a low cost, which has helped her to continue improving her income.
