Claudia is asking for this loan so she can purchase used garments for re-sale.  This way she will be able to stock up her business and offer her customers a greater variety to choose from.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 39 years of age, married, and a mother of three children. She has a strong determination. She is engaged in selling various clothes in the market; she has managed her business for nine years. Agnes' goal in life is help her children finish their studies and get a stable job. Her goal is the most important thing in her life that she needs to be patience and work hard to attain it. With regards to her clothing business, Agnes wants to borrow a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy clothes to sell in the market. She believes that the loan will have a big contribution in attaining her goal.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: María Blanca Ligia

texts.es: La señora María es una mujer de 58 años de edad que laboro durante muchos años realizando contabilidad a ciertas empresas, pero ante la urgencia del cuidado de sus hijos pequeños María tuvo que dejar este empleo y dedicarse por completo a ellos pues pario a 3 hijos, impulsada por una amiga comenzó a vender dulces extranjeros en la entrada de un colegio labor que ha ejercido por los últimos 13 años de su vida y con la que se siente más que satisfecha pues buscaba sentirse útil en su casa que no solo su marido generara un ingreso ella quería aportar tener su propio capital no esperar a que le den un centavo, por esta razón solicita su primer crédito con el que piensa adentrarse en otro mundo en la venta ropa para hombre y dama y surtir su negocio actual ya que solo vende en colegios tiene un horario muy cómodo y quiere invertir el resto de tiempo en la venta de otros artículos que le generen un ingreso con el cual pueda aportar a los gastos universitarios de sus hijos ya que ella no descansara hasta ver convertidos en todos unos profesionales a sus dos hijos menores
texts.en:
María is a 58-year-old woman who used to work in accounting at certain companies for many years. Faced with the urgency of having to take care of her young children, María had to leave this job and devote herself entirely to them. She gave birth to 3 children. Motivated by a friend, she began to sell candy from other countries at the entrance of a school. She has had this work for the last 13 years of her life and she feels more than satisfied with it. María was looking to feel useful at home and to not have her husband be the only one generating income. She wanted to contribute and have her own money and to not wait to be given some. 

Therefore, María is requesting her first loan with which she is thinking about venturing into the world of selling men's and women's clothes and to also stock her current business since she only sells at schools. She has a very flexible schedule and she wants to invest the remainder of her time in selling other items that generate income with which she could contribute to her children's college expenses. She will not rest until she sees her two youngest children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jeans, shirts, blouses, and pants in order to start a new business selling clothes and to stock her candy store so she can provide some support for her 2 youngest children's college expenses.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
Nueva estrella es un grupo unido, que está luchando por seguir mejorando y crecer cada una en los microemprendimientos que van haciendo.
Ana es una mujer muy creativa que integra este grupo, se dedica a la venta de termos forrados, es muy creativa y ese es su clave de éxito. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar termos, cueros y pegamento, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir haciendo las artesanías que vende.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Estrella" group is united, and striving to improve and grow, each one in the micro-enterprise they run
.
Ana is a very creative women who is a member of the group and sells covered thermoses. She is very creative and this is her key to success. Ana is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, and it will be very useful in helping her to grow. She is requesting this loan to by thermoses, leather and glue so she can continue to make the thermoses she sells.

loans.use: to buy thermoses, leather and glue to continue her handicrafts.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: Ana es una ya experimentada mujer madre de 3 hijos quien junto con su padre de 70 años (ver en la foto) juntaron unos ahorros y decidieron montar una legumbre-ria con la cual pudieran sostener su hogar ya que viven los 5, Ana con sus tres hijos y su padre, su idea surgió ante la necesidad de generar un ingreso ya que Ana no tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo y tenía que atender a sus hijos de 5, 10, 11 años de edad pro lo que no podía salir a buscar un empleo y sus papa ya por la avanzada edad no le daban ningún empleo, montaron esta tienda que le permite generar un ingresos a su familia sin descuidar su papel como madre, Ana solicita un crédito para compra de surtido como cebolla, papas. Mazorca, aguacates, tomates e incluir algunos abarrotes como arroz, panela entre otros para comenzar a tener una tienda más completa y futurizándola como un mini mercado el cual es el sueño de Ana que solo quiere darle lo mejor de sí a sus hijos ofreciéndoles una excelente calidad de vida y haciéndoles saber lo mucho que ella lucha por ellos
texts.en: Ana is already an experienced woman. She is the mother of three children, and along with her 70-year-old father (seen in the photo), they put together some savings and decided to set up a vegetable stand with which they could support their household. Since they were five, Ana with her three children and her father, their idea arose from the necessity of generating an income, since Ana doesn't have much work experience and she has to care for her children, ages 5, 10, and 11. For these reasons, she could not go out to look for a job, and her father, because of his advanced age, wouldn't be given any employment. They set up this store, which allows her to generate an income for her family without neglecting her role as a mother. Ana is applying for a loan for the purchase of stock such as onions, potatoes, corn on the cob, avocados, and tomatoes, and including some groceries such as rice and raw cane sugar, among other items, in order to begin having a more complete shop and futurizing it as a mini market, which is the dream of Ana, who only wants to give the best of herself to her children, offering them an excellent quality of life and letting them know how much she struggles for them.

loans.use: to buy stock such as onions, potatoes, and tomatoes, and also groceries such as raw cane sugar and rice, among other items.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir, this wonderful Egyptian Albanian, has been photographed with his youngest child who turned four recently. The loan that he got previously from Kiva lenders he used to add goats to the herd. Now he is back needing your help again, yet this time, he wants to make some basic home repairs.

loans.use: to make some basic home repairs

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Moungkul Borey district, Som is 64 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as car repairers, and sometimes they work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 80,000 KHR per day. 

Som has been with VisionFund for seven cycles, and she completely paid back the past loans. As the leader, she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Som wants to use her portion to buy gasoline and some spare parts for supporting her repairing business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and some spare parts for supporting her repair business

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jaya Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Jaya Maa Santoshi. It was formed in the year 2013. All four women members of this group are from the village of Badi in Nuapada district of Odisha, India, and belong to the BPL (below poverty line) category. Surya, standing on the extreme left, is one of them. She is 24 years of age and lives with her husband, one son of 4 years and one daughter of 5 years of age. Surya is a very active lady, but shy in nature. She has very good understanding, but talks less.

Surya has been running a betel nut shop in a wooden cabin on the road point of her village with the help of her husband for the last six years. She sells biscuits, toffees, soap, shampoo and food items in her shop. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from her business. Anyway, she was managing her family with this small amount. 

When her children started reading in school, she felt the need for money in the future for their education and development. She decided to expand her business. So, she motivated three other women from her locality and took a loan of 10,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. She used this loan for purchasing daily use items like soap, biscuits, shampoo and food items. 

She hopes that this investment will generate more income and will help her to give better education to her children and build a house for her family. 

The other three members are named Sabita, Laxmi and Satyabati and are also doing micro-enterprises like manufacturing of sweet and salty food items, fishing and fish selling.

loans.use: to purchase daily use items like soap, biscuits, shampoo and food items.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El Sr Ever  es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia. 
El está haciendo un doctorado en derecho, que le permitirá poder incrementar sus conocimientos, de manera a seguir creciendo no solo como persona sino también como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas del doctorado, ya que es un poco costoso y quiere poder cubrir ese trabajo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Ever is a very responsible person who is dedicated to his studies and to his family.

He is studying for a doctorate in law, which will allow him to increase his knowledge, in a way that he will continue growing not only as a person but also as a professional.

He is requesting this loan to be able to able to pay the fees for the doctorate, since it is a bit expensive and he wants to be able to cover this work. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving and that will be of much help to him.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his doctoral degree

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita, aged 60, is widowed and has three children. She has been a vegetable vendor in her village for almost ten years and earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her net income is usually spent on daily expenses at home. Perlita wants to take out a loan due to a lack of capital in her business; she would like to borrow 5,000 PHP to purchase tomatoes, cabbage, eggplants, string beans, and squash to sell. She's hoping that her business will improve to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, cabbage, eggplants, string beans, and squash to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her own business: a stationary store and internet cafe, with which she will to fix up a piece of land that she bought with her savings and to purchase a printer, two computers and a display case to start her business.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Mongkul Borey district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Sambath is a 28-year-old mother of one dependent child. Rice farming, which she and her husband have been in for eight years, is the main source of her family’s income. Her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is the second microloan with Kiva’s partner for Sambath, who completely paid back the first loan. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Sambath will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family income so as to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Luce

texts.en: Luce built the stable that she intended to with her previous loan, and now she is back to add another dairy cow to her existing herd. According to Luce, she is happy that she was able to build the stable before winter started. Here is what she said: "I was all worried about my animals, how would they stay another winter in the coldness of the previous stable. Thank God, lenders were kind enough to think about my animals and, of course, my family's well-being. I very much appreciate it."

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the existing herd.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Dambae district, Hen is 43 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a rice farmer, while her husband also grows cassava to earn additional income. Having been in this business for almost 29 years, she currently can earn about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Hen has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay land rental for growing her rice and cassava. She hopes to grow her crops in a timely way so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to pay land rental for growing her rice and cassava

loans.name: Samart

texts.en:
Aged 39 years, Samart is a married mother of five children living in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 11 years. She is able to earn about 80,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Samart has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid her past loans. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on gasoline. She hopes to produce more rice so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Vicente  está en su 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las señoras se encuentran en un nivel de ingresos escasos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a la peluquería, ella es una dedicada mujer que lucha por poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino.
Juana pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues,  cremas y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar su vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The San Vicente group is in its second cycle of the womens' committee program, where everyone is involved to work and to help each other between all of them in order to come out ahead. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination, where two of the women find themselves in a level of few resources. One of the members is Sra. Juana, who is dedicated to haircutting. She is a dedicated woman that fights to be able to help her family by way of her work. She comments that she began with very little, but little by little she has paved her way. 

Juana asks for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of tints, shampoo, rinses, creams and the other supplies in order to be able to continue with her work, fighting to improve her life and the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase tints, shampoo, rinses, creams and other supplies.

loans.name: Villa 23 Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Villa 23 Santa Ana está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comités, es un grupo nuevo que está aprendiendo a trabajar de manera unida y tiene las expectativas puestas en seguir mejorando sus vidas.
Felicita es vendedora de cosméticos, siempre tiene todo tipo de ellos, y muy buena variedad a buen precio. Ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo, es una mujer muy luchadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The Villa 23 Santa Ana group is in its first cycle in the committee program. It is a new group that is learning to work as a team and has the expectations set in continuing to improve their lives. 

Felicita is a cosmetic saleswoman. She always has every type, and a very good variety at a fair price. She helps her family by way of her work; she is a very determined woman who with strength and sacrifice is coming out ahead. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of various cosmetics in order to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing, fighting for better income.

loans.use: to purchase various cosmetics for their sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron, a table, fabric and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Tum's Group

texts.en:
Tum, age 53, lives in a wooden house in a village in the Moung Russey district, and she is married. She is the mother of six children. Rice farming is the only source of income for her family which Tum and her husband have been doing for 29 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Tum has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to increase her rice crop so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es:
Javier inicio junto a un familiar un negocio de reparación de bicicletas, negocio que iba marchando ala perfección hasta le día que su socio lo abandono dejándolo solo con el local, el problema es que Javier no tenía tanta experiencia en arreglar estos vehículos pero gracias a la ayuda de un amigo puedo perfeccionar sus técnicas para darles un servicio oportuno y de calidad a los clientes que se acercaban a solicitar sus servicios. De la mano con la reparación de bicicletas ha estado aprendiendo la reparación de motocicletas en la que le colabora un empleado la mayor parte de tiempo por lo que este genera un empleo. 
Javier por ser un humilde ciudadano no posee los recursos suficiente para tener todas las herramientas necesarias para cualquier tipo de trabajo que le soliciten por ende solicita su primer crédito para la compra de un compresor y un plancha para colocar parches, con el dinero restante adecuara su negocio ya que es un establecimiento hecho con madera y techo de palma su gran sueño es poder tener un negocio, hermoso bien visto con bastantes clientes y formar una familia a la cual mantener con su negocio
texts.en:
Javier started his bicycle repair business together with a family member.  The business was going perfectly until the day his business partner abandoned him, leaving him alone with the shop.  The problem is that Javier didn't have very much experience in fixing that type of vehicle.  Thanks to the help of a friend, Javier is perfecting his technique so he can give timely, quality service to the customers who seek his services.  In addition to the bicycle repair, Javier has also been learning motorcycle repair.  He works together with an employee for the motorcycle repair most of the time, which generates employment. 
Javier, being a modest citizen, does not have sufficient resources to have all the necessary tools for any type of work he could be asked to do.  Consequently, he is requesting his first loan so he can purchase a compressor and an iron for putting on patches.  With the rest of the money, he will fix up his commercial space, as the establishment is made of wood and has a palm roof.  His grand dream is to have a nice looking business with plenty of customers and to start a family that he would support through his business.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and an iron for putting on patches.  The rest of the money will be invested in fixing up his commercial space.

loans.name: Gladis Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Gladis es una orgullosa dueña de un establecimiento dedicado a la cría y venta de marramos, actividad que ha venido desarrollando desde la juventud y que aprendió de sus padres, cabe aclarar que este es el único ingreso familiar por el cual le ha puesto el mejor empeño para no dejar que este negocio quede en quiebra pues muchas veces se ha visto amenazado por los repentinos cambios climáticos, desde fuertes lluvias, hasta números días de sequía, pero ante todas estas adversidades Gladis ha sabido mantenerse y perdurar, y cree que este es el momento para comenzar a crecer y sacar provecho del cierre de otras marraneras por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos, con los que esperar atender un mayor número de clientes que recurrirán a su negocio ante el cierre de otros establecimientos semejantes.
El gran sueño de Gladis es poder tener un gran negocio reconocido por todos, una bella y grande casa donde pueda compartir los mejores momentos de su vida junto con su familia
texts.en:
Gladis is the proud owner of an establishment dedicated to the raising and sale of pigs, an activity that she has been involved in since her youth and that she learned from her parents. It is worth clarifying that this is the sole income for the family, so she has given it her best efforts to keep this business from bankruptcy. It has been threatened by climatic changes, from strong rains to numerous days of drought, but in the face of so much adversity, Gladis has known how to survive and keep going. 

She believes that this is the moment to begin to grow and take advantage of the closing of other pig farms. To this end, she is requesting a loan to buy pigs, with which she hopes to tend to a greater number of clients that will come to her business due to the closing of other similar establishments. 

Gladis' big dream is to have a large-scale business that everyone recognizes, and a big, beautiful house where she can share the best moments of her life together with her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to cover the potential demand from her customers, faced with similar establishments shutting down.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children; her children are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of selling clothes for three years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for the purpose of reselling them, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Imtiaz is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He could also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan. Imtiaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some more different types of clothing in bulk for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura trabaja en una huerta clasificando las verduras para los supermercados y vive con su mamá y hermana. 
También está estudiando la carrera de Farmacéutica, y comenta que sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en lo que está estudiando para poder tener mejores ingresos y así poder ayudarle a su mamá.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de estudios, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura works in a large vegetable garden, classifying the vegetables for supermarkets. She lives with her mother and sister.

She also is studying for a Pharmacy degree, and comments that her future goals are to work at what she is studying so she can have a better income and help her mother. 

She is requesting this loan to pay the fees for her studies, so she can continue to study as she has been doing.

loans.use: To pay college fees.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, comenta que su meta es obtener su título para poder trabajar y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
Él está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, con lo que quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es su salud, y poder ayudarles a mejorar su estilo de vida.
 Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, que le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lorena is from the city of San Ignacio. She comments that her goal is to obtain her degree so that she can work and help her loved ones through her work.

She is studying for a degree in nutrition, with which she wants to be able to help other people in something as important as their health and to be able to help them improve their style of living.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees, which would be a great help to her. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay college fees.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es estudiante de la carrera de Medicina, vive con sus padres en Paraguarí, tiene como meta terminar sus estudios y ser un gran profesional de la salud, con lo cual podrá ayudar a las personas que necesitan de su servicio.
Su inspiración es su familia que siempre le da todo y su meta retribuirle de la mejor manera.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad, y también poder pagar sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ramon is a student in the medical program. He lives with his parents in Paraguarí. His goal is to finish his studies and be a good health professional, so that he can help people who need his services.

His inspiration is his family, which has always given him everything, and his goal is to repay them in the best way.

He is requesting this loan to be able to cover his university fees and also to be able to pay his transportation expenses. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving and that will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay his university fees and cover transportation expenses.

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en: A mother of three kids residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Oeurn is 41 years old and a local farmer who only does rice farming as her main source of income. For Oeurn, she has been in this business for 21 years, and it generates 18,300 KHR per day for her. This is the fourth time borrowing from VisionFund, Kiva’s field partner. She has fully repaid back her past three loans with success, and it has enabled her to financially support her business promptly. As the leader of her group, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for pond digging fees for her new start-up business, a fish business. She highly hopes that her family’s business and her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to pay for pond digging fees for her fish business.

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Burbuqe, whose name in English means ‘Bud’, has been scheduled for a surgical heart procedure and she is seeking your compassion.  According to the health specialists, the sooner her surgery takes place the better for her health.  Burbuqe suffered from a heart attack right after she gave birth to her only son, about 27 years ago.  During her interview she said she had an operation then, and now needs another procedure that will last 20 more years.

Despite her health conditions, she works hard: she raises rabbits, ducks, and chickens.  Burbuqe also participates in agriculture; she has 450 apple orchards and plants lima beans and wheat in large quantities to sell to wholesale buyers.  A traditional meal in her region is lima beans with tomato sauce cooked in a pan in the oven.

loans.use: to pay for a scheduled surgical heart procedure.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 23-year-old single man from Khanyounis. He lives with his family in a very small house. His father works as a farmer where he plants seasonal crops. Naji would like to start his own business and be independent. He decided to buy a rickshaw so he can transfer goods for the local traders. It is a good business.
 
Naji took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a rickshaw for his work. By taking this loan, Naji will be able to improve the family living conditions and increase the family's income.
 
Naji appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Khanyounis, working as an employee in the public sector.  He lives with his wife and six kids, four sons and two daughters, in a very small house.  Mohammad would like to improve his family's living conditions by working extra hours operating a rickshaw to transport goods for local traders.  It is a good business. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy a rickshaw for his work.  By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his family's living conditions and increasing the family income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his work.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva está estudiando licenciatura  enfermería, y comenta que su  objetivo es tener dos títulos universitarios, y de esa forma abrirse camino.
Su familia es su fuerza de voluntad de todos los días, comenta que es casada y que tiene un hijo. Su meta es obtener su título de licenciada para así mejorar sus ingresos, y tener una mejor calidad de vida, y por supuesto brindarle a mi hijo una buena educación.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y también cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Eva is studying for a degree in nursing and notes that her objective is to earn two university degrees and thereby get ahead. Her family is her source of strength every day. She mentions that she is married and has a son. Her goal is to get her degree so that she can improve her income and have a better quality of life. In addition she wants to provide her son with a good education.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay her tuition fees and also to cover transportation expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and to cover transportation costs.

loans.name: Antonino

texts.es:
Antonino es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es una persona que se está esmerando por poder ayudar a su familia y poder retribuirles todo lo que ellos le han dado, es por eso que son su mayor inspiración.
Él está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en informática, algo que le apasiona mucho y que le ayudará a poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a la vez que se siente un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Quiere seguir estudiando, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder cubrir sus cuotas, y continuar luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Antonino is from the city of Villarrica. He is a person who is focusing on being able to help his family and being able to pay them back for everything that they have given him. It is for this reason that they are his biggest inspiration.

He is studying in the computer science engineering program, a subject that he is very passionate about and that will help him to be able to improve his living conditions, at the same time that he will consider himself a useful professional to society.

He wants to continue studying. It is for this reason that he is requesting this loan, to be able to cover his fees and continue striving toward his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura está en el último año de la carrera de Ingeniería  Agronómica
y comenta que sus padres solventan los gastos de sus estudios hasta hoy día, en este año realizará su trabajo  de tesis, y cuando termine, su meta es trabajar y seguir estudiando.
Desea realizar post grado, así será una especialista en una área específica de la Agronomía.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de tesis, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Laura is in the final year of the Agronomic Engineering program, and she comments that her parents have paid the expenses of her education up to now. In this year, she will complete her thesis work, and when she finishes, her goal is to work and continue studying.

She wants to do post-graduate work. Thus she will be a specialist in a specific area of agronomy.

She is requesting this loan to be able to cover her thesis expenses and in this way be able to continue striving toward her goal.

loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Baking and selling of breads in the market is the business of Lanie. She is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. Her husband is her partner in managing their bakery business. 

Through their earned profits from the business, six of Lanie’s children already finished their college education. Her only goal from now is to finish her youngest child's study so he will also hold a degree. 

Lanie is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy sugar, margarine, wheat flour, and raw ingredients in baking breads. She hopes to produce more breads, encourage more customers to buy, and earn higher income to support her child's allowances and other needs for finishing his studies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, margarine, wheat flour, and raw ingredients for baking breads.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy different vegetables for her business. Her loan helped, not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her children's everyday needs. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs, and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Jane dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 54 years of age, widowed, and has three children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village for almost fifteen years, and earning a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenses and the other is for savings for future emergencies. 

Due to lack of capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase biscuits, coffee, sugar, soap, and canned goods to resell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and improve more.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, coffee, sugar, soap, and canned goods to resell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  Virginia has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Vicente

texts.es: Rafael ha sido un hombre que se dedicó junto a su padre a la comercialización de productos de construcción, negocio con el que pudo criar a sus tres hijos hasta el punto de convertirlos en todos unos hombres, ya por sus 54 años de edad no puede conseguir un empleo y es por esto que comenzó con su negocio un pequeño plante de 100 mil pesos y que poco a poco iba aumentando, hoy en día quiere crecer, tiene aspiraciones el cree ciegamente que la edad no es limitante de nada que con corazón y ganas puede lograr grandes cosas por esto solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales para la distribución a sus clientes y está dispuesto a hacer grandes recorridos a pie ya que es un vendedor ambulante con tal de hacer llegar su producto a otros lugares y generar buenos ingresos con los que pueda mantenerse en la vejez
texts.en:
Rafael has been a man that, together with his father, was dedicated to the commercialization of construction products, the business with which he could raise his three children until the point of them all becoming men. Due to his age of 54 he cannot get a job and it is because of this that he began with his business, a small seed of one hundred thousand pesos that little by little he has been augmenting. 

Today he wants to grow, he has aspirations. He wholeheartedly believes that age is not a limit for anything, that with heart and will he can achieve big things. Due to this he is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials for their distribution to his customers and he is ready to cover a lot of ground on foot, as he is a mobile salesman, just to get his product to other places. This way he will generate good income with which he can support himself in his old age.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the sale of construction materials.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is been photographed with Kastriot, her husband.  Together they have two school-aged children, ages 18 and 14.  Suzana is 48 years old and is requesting this loan to pay for her husband’s surgical eye procedure.  His vision has been worsening due to some health issues. They operate an agriculture and livestock business to earn an income.

Suzana has three dairy cows and plants feed, such as corn and fodder, for animals, and sells them to other villagers.  She also sells the raw milk to a nearby primitive type of dairy farm.  Her cows are of a quality breed and the milk production is quite high, about 20kg/day.  The village where they have resided their entire lives, is known across the country for producing the highest and best quantity of beans, red onions, and potatoes.  Villagers here own large areas of agricultural land. Traditional meal is a pie with white kale.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's surgical eye procedure.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 44, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with six children. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 11 years, she is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
 
Eng has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products, such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alicia hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her family a good life. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería cursando el segundo año  y también está estudiando la carrera de nutrición.
Comenta que tiene un de pasajes y encomiendas hace 6 meses y de ese trabajo paga sus estudios
Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en su profesión para poder seguir estudiando y mantener o ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en los gastos de sus estudios, ya que de esa forma podrá comprar libros, fotocopias y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gladys is a student in the nursing program. She is in her second year and is also studying in the nutrition program. She comments that she had a job working with passengers and cargo six months ago, and from this work she is paying for her studies.

Her future goals are working in her profession, being able to continue studying, and supporting or helping her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in her educational expenses, since in this way she will be able to buy books, photocopies, and other items. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving and that will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay for books, photocopies, and other items

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia vive en Curupayty , vive con su madre, y comenta que está en el segundo curso  de la carrera de Licenciatura en Ciencias contables, carrera con la cual quiere poder desarrollarse como persona y como profesional.
Su meta es terminar la carrera y después trabajar, los gastos de su universidad las paga con su sueldo, ya que a la vez que trabaja, también estudia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma está luchando y más cerca de su meta de ser profesional.
texts.en: Lidia lives in Curupayty with her mother. She says that she is in the second course of her accounting sciences degree, a degree which she hopes will help her develop as a person and as a professional. Her goal is to finish the degree and to go to work afterwards. She is also working now, in addition to studying, and she covers her university costs with her salary. She requests this loan to pay for her tuition and in this way she is working hard and getting closer to her goal of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El señor Moisés vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, en el lugar cuenta con escasos recursos económicos y además tiene un hijo que depende de sus ingresos, el señor tiene muchas ganas de superarse, vive con su conyugue y trabaja en su actividad económica agrícola como actividad primaria, tiene que contratar personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas, su casa es rustica y no tiene obra fina y cuenta con pocos muebles y enseres,  desde sus niñez ayudaba a su padres en la actividad agrícola así que tiene mucha experiencia, actualmente utiliza lo tradicional que son sus propias yuntas, dado que no tiene muchos recursos económicos, solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas  de esa manera mejorara sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Moisés lives in a rural part of Tiraque province. He has scant economic resources; additionally, he has a son who is dependent on his income. He has a strong desire to overcome. He lives with his spouse, and his principal work is farming.

He has to hire temporary workers for the planting and harvesting of his agricultural products. His house is rustic; he doesn't have any fine things, and he has little furniture or furnishings. Since he was a child, he helped his parents with the farmwork; therefore, he has a lot of experience. Currently, he uses the traditional method, which is his own yoke of oxen.

As he doesn't have many financial resources, he is requesting a loan for the purchase of farming supplies. In this way, he will improve his earnings and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his annual tuition fees and other study expenses.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used buy additional sacks of rice. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to purchase additional sacks of rice needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lina dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her shop for her vulcanizing shop business.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. Teresita earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her shop

loans.name: Shilpi

texts.en:
Shilpi is a 30-year-old woman from the village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri, where vegetable cultivation is the primary source of livelihood of most of the villagers. Shilpi is married to Bablu, 29 years old, who is also associated with an agribusiness.  
 
Shilpi has a vegetable cultivation farm.  She and her husband manage the farm.  Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like eggplant, cauliflower, carrots, beans, chili, cucumber and papaya on their farm.  They sell their products to the traders of the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm.  But the profit they earn is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of their family as well as the farm expenses. Shilpi wants to expand her business by cultivating jute, but lacks the capital.  So she has taken a loan from BJS to buy fertilizers and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. She also hopes to give a bright future to her family with her earnings.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: helps Ali to pay for his son's school fees.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de kalaban-coro chef-lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de kalaban-coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, poissons et des pagnes wax. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fati (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du  poisson de toutes les variétés. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400kg de poisson frais à Kabala au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. Madame Fati espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Danaya group are mainly married in polygamous households. They are on average 48 years old with six children. They all live in Kalaban-Coro, the main village in the county of Kati (in the second administrative region of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kalaban-Coro market. Group members are small retail merchants of fish and pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric). In order to resupply with cash, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fati (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) has a great reputation selling all kinds of fish. She intends to use her loan to buy 400 kilos of fresh fish in Kabala, along the Niger River. Retail sales are for cash and on credit, at the market and as an itinerant vendor, to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Fati hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 125,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure her children's upkeep.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Kiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Samè. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, poissons, atelier de couture et des condiments. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (debout  en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du  poisson de toutes les variétés.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kg de poisson frais à Kabala au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The seven women of the "Danaya" group are married and live mainly in monogamous households. They are on average 38 years old with three children. They all live in the Samè, in the town of Mandé, Kati circle; they know each other through neighborhood connections and their income-generating activities at the Samè market. The group members run small businesses selling fish, clothing, and condiments. With the goal of resupplying themselves in cash, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Mariam (standing second from the right in the photo) has built a good reputation selling fish of all varieties. She intends to use her loan to buy 100 kg of fresh fish in Kabala, next to the Niger river. The resale will take place in cash and on credit at the market and door-to-door to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Ms. Mariam hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 85,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and married with five children who are in school. Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, egg, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, egg, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Jahara

texts.en:
Jahara is only 20 years old, energetic and has the courage to go ahead in life. She is married to Nur, 22 years old.  Together they are raising two children (one son and one daughter), who are too young to attend school.  Jahara attended school up to grade seven but her husband is uneducated and can only sign his name. They live in a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district in their own house.

Jahara's husband is a mason who has no consistent income. Jahara practices livestock breeding to give financial support to his husband. She started this business three years back when her husband's income was very poor. She sells milk to her neighbors.

With the determination to further develop her business, Jahara turned to BJS (Kiva’s partner). She is requesting a loan from them to buy one more cow. She is determined to increase the size of her livestock in order to fundamentally increase her family's income so they do not have to face any financial crisis.
   
She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Bindeswari

texts.en:
Bindeswari is 38 years old.  She is a married woman from the small village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.  She attended school up to grade five. She is a mother of four children (three sons and one daughter).  All of them are students and read in grade 10, 7, 5 and 1, respectively.  Her husband Gayakanta is engaged in cultivation.

Bindeswari's husband farms a variety of crops on their own farmland.  Bindeswari also helps her husband in farming by sowing seeds, harvesting and carrying the produces to the market for sale.  This agribusiness is the only source of income for the family. But it is extremely difficult for them to manage the household costs as well as the educational costs of their children with such a small income.  They need to expand their business by cultivating some other profitable crop like jute. They need some capital for jute cultivation.

Bindeswari applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), to buy jute seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs.  She hopes that this new crop will support them with good earnings to cover the expenses of a six-member family.  She will use the profit from her business to give a good education to her children, strengthen the family economy and purchase a tractor in the future to help with their agriculture.

She is very much glad and thankful towards the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankeletigui est composé de cinq  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques (mèches), des chaussures plastiques, de la farine et d’habits. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des mèches de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 paquets  de mèche à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au à Niomirambougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui group comprises five married women who live mainly in monogamous households. They are on average 35 years old with three children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of the areas of Bamako, and know each other through neighborhood connections. The group members run small businesses selling cosmetics (hair extensions), plastic shoes, flour, and clothing. With the goal of resupplying themselves upfront, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Fatoumata (all the way on the left in the photo) has built a good reputation selling hair extensions of high quality. She intends to use her loan to buy 5 packets of hair extensions in Bamako. The resale will take place at retail in Niomirambougou to a clientele composed primarily of women. With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business. With her link to Soro Yiriwaso, one of her objectives is to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six  membres du groupe Faïda ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons), chaussures plastiques, ustensiles plastiques, céréales et habits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Fanta (femme  assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs d’oignons à Bamako.La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fanta compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mostly in monogamous households, the six members of the "Faïda" group are on average 37 years old with four children. They all live in Niomirambougou, an area of Bamako, and know each other through neighborhood connections and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market. The group members run small businesses selling condiments (onions), plastic shoes, plastic utensils, cereals, and clothing. With the intention of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Fanta (sitting all the way on the right in the photo) is a major seller of condiments (onions). She intends to use her loan to buy 20 bags of onions in Bamako. The resale will take place at retail in Niomirambougou and door-to-door to a clientele composed mostly of women. With this loan, Ms. Fanta hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay for some of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit  membres du groupe Siguidia ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè dans la commune du  Mandé / cercle de Kati  et  se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Samè. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la friperie de tous genres, de condiments, d’ustensiles plastiques et de calebasses. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Coumba (debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande  vendeuse d’habits de la friperie de meilleures qualités et de tous les genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles d’habits à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Coumba compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mostly in monogamous households, the eight members of the "Siguidia" group are on average 43 years old with five children. They all live in Samè, in the town of Mandé / Kati circle, and know each other through family links, neighborhood connections, and their income-generating activities at the Samè market. The group members run small businesses selling secondhand clothing of all kinds, condiments, plastic utensils, and bottle gourds. With the intention of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Coumba (standing all the way on the right in the photo) is a major seller of high quality secondhand clothing of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to buy bales of clothing in Bamako. The resale will take place at retail at the market and door-to-door to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Ms. Coumba hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay for some of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Abdou est un promoteur qui évolue dans des accessoires de téléphones portables. Il est célibataire et vit avec ses parents. Ayant une expérience de 3ans, il sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour acheter et vendre des accessoires de téléphones portables dans un  marché de la place. Il a comme charges particulières ces charges personnelles. Abdou commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 23h. A l’avenir il souhaite augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et ouvrir un grand magasin dans sa localité. Il a choisi ce métier par amour.
texts.en: Mr. Abdou is a promoter who is involved in selling cellphone accessories. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. With three years' experience, he is seeking this loan of 100,000 F to buy and sell cellphone accessories at a market in the area. His specific expenses are his personal ones. Abdou begins his workday at 9am and ends at 11pm. In the future, he hopes to expand his stock of merchandise in order to increase his income and open a large store in his area. He chose this business based on his personal preference.

loans.use: To buy and sell phones and cellphone accessories

loans.name: Pytyvora Group

texts.es:
Pytyvora está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Amalia.
Ella en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que esta en un nivel medio, donde a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es  ama de casa y se dedica a la confección de Puff y a la vez cada fin de semana realiza venta de asaditos para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra por cantidad sus carne, condimentos, panificados, etc., lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pytyvora is in its 1st loan cycle with the women's committee, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where one of the members is Ms. Amalia.

In her last survey, she showed a poverty level in level two; this means that she is at a middle level, where, through her effort, continual work, and the application of the conduct necessary for a successful woman, she has found herself improving her poverty situation. Regarding the work that she does, she says that she is a homemaker and that she works making puff pastries. At the same time, every weekend she sells roast meat snacks in order to improve her life and that of her family.

She is requesting this loan for the bulk purchase of her meat, condiments, baked goods, etc., which will aid her in materializing her business plan, which will help her to improver her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Galenur

texts.en:
Galenur is a 45-year-old woman, who is married to Jaharuddin, a cycle van puller.  She and her husband are raising only one son.  They live in a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Both are illiterate and can only sign their names.  Due to the financial crisis, they could not afford much for their son's education.Now he is grown up and works as a mason.

Galenur's husband is a cycle van puller.  A cycle van is a kind of transport that is widely used in remote regions of India, especially in West Bengal.  He carries loads and people in his van, thus earning money to cover the expenses of his family's household.  Very recently, the van was damaged due to an accident, so it requires repairs. As a result, it has become impossible for him to meet the basic needs of his family as his income has stopped. They thought it over and have decided to purchase a new cycle van, but lack the capital.

Galenur heard that BJS gives financial assistance to rural women and she took a loan to purchase a new cycle van for her husband.This will allow her husband to carry on his earnings. Galenur hopes to improve her husband's service, expand his customer base and earn more profit.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for funding them.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Janata

texts.en:
Janata is an enterprising woman. She lives in Kholaigram in Jalpaiguri with her husband and children.

Janata's husband Abinash, 42 years old, is engaged in an agribusiness.  They have farmland of their own where he grows betel leaves to sell in the wholesale market.  Janata also contributes her efforts to growing betel leaves. It requires a great effort to grow betel leaves. Betel leaves, locally known as ‘Pan’, is a kind of mouth freshener used especially in rural areas. There is a great demand for betel leaves in their village. Thus, they have chosen this business.

Now Janata is requesting a loan to grow her business. She will cultivate a new crop of betel leaves.  She plans to purchase seedlings and essential supplies to cultivate this crop.  Her plan is to grow betel leaves on a large scale in the future.  She can then earn more and strengthen her business. In addition, Janata's priority is to provide a good education to her children and purchase more land for cultivation.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase saplings and essential supplies to cultivate betel leaves.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos y además tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando y dependen de sus ingresos, vive con su esposa y trabaja arduamente en su actividad económica agrícola y pecuaria como actividad primaria, tiene que contratar personal eventual para siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas que son sus vecinos, su casa está construida de adobe es rustica y no tiene obra fina por dentro y además no tiene muchos muebles y enseres, desde pequeño trabaja en su actividad utilizando sus yuntas, todavía no utiliza la tecnología agrícola. Actualmente solicita un credito para la compra de terreno agrícola de esa manera mejorara sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Rene lives in a rural area of the Tiraque Province.  He does not have many economic resources and has four children who study and depend on his income.  He lives with his wife and works hard in in his agricultural and livestock business which is his main source of income.  He hires his neighbors as temporary workers for planting and harvesting his crops.  His rustic house is made of adobe and inside does not have much furniture or appliances.  Since he was young he has always worked with teams of oxen, as he does not use agricultural technology.  Rene is requesting a loan to buy farmland to improve his income and the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram, who is pictured in the photo, is a 22-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife and three kids--two sons and one daughter--in a very small house. He works as an employee in the public sector. He would also like to improve his family's living conditions by working extra hours in a rickshaw, which he could use to transfer goods for local traders. It is a good business.

Akram took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a rickshaw, which will enable him to improve his family's living conditions and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Lidia Angelica

texts.es: La señora Lidia tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que dependen de sus ingresos, cuenta con un grado de instrucción de nivel primario, es muy responsable y trabajadora ademas tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Su principal actividad es el servicio de gastronomía ella elabora hamburguesas entre otras cosas, vende en la puerta de su casa en su carrito hamburguesero que adquirió recientemente pero no está en buenas condiciones, por esa razón necesita  un crédito para el mantenimiento de su carrito hamburguesero y compra de un refrigerador pequeño, con estas herramientas lograra elaborar con más rapidez su hamburguesas y mejorara su ventas y por consiguiente podrá generar más ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Lidia, 32, is a single mother with three small children who depend on her income.  She has a primary education and is very repsonsible and hard-working because she is determined to get ahead.  Her main activity is her hamburger business.  She sells hamburgers door-to-door with the cart she bought recently but which is not in very good shape.  Therefore, she needs a loan to repair the cart and to buy a small refrigerator.  With these tools she will be able to make hamburgers quicker and increase sales, thereby increasing her income to provide for her children.

loans.use: To repair her hamburger cart and buy a small refrigerator.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 23 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Cristy has previously taken out and repaid 7 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns income from buying and selling charcoal.

Cristy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: El señor Darío, tiene 38 años de edad es casado y tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la actividad agrícola que es su principal fuente de ingresos, sin embargo en la época anterior fue afectado directamente con el precio de la cebolla el cual desestabilizo su economía familiar. El señor es una persona responsable y trabajadora, pero el precio del mercado mencionado lo perjudico ocasionando una disminución de sus ingresos económicos por lo que no pudo pagar la adquisición de los materiales e insumos requeridos para la producción agrícola y la educación de sus hijos, para enmendar lo mencionado anteriormente, solicita un crédito para la compra de semilla de cebolla, abono y agroquímicos, con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y estabilizar la economía de su familia para retomar el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Darío, 38, is married and has three dependent children who attend school.  His main source of income is his agriculture business, but last season he was affected by the onion prices which destabilized the family economy.  Darío is a responsible, hard-working man but the market price mentioned earlier caused a decrease in income and he was unable to pay for the materials and supplies he needed for crop production and to educate his children.

To remedy the situation he is requesting a loan to buy onion seeds, compost and farm chemicals in order to improve his quality of life and stabilize the family economy to get back on the road of prosperity.

loans.use: To buy onion seeds, compost and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is 40 years old. He is not married, and he lives with his retired parents in the village of Lusnadzor, in the Tavush region. Being the only child in his family, Hayk works very hard to provide for his parents. For many years, he used to work abroad in the Russian Federation, but since his parents are getting older, it has become very hard to leave them alone for such a long period of time. That is why he decided to run their farm himself, which also enables him to be close to his parents. The farm has 7 cows, 2 piglets, and 20 chickens. Hayk also cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, and fruits such as plums, apples, pears, and grapes. He sells half of the harvest to his regular customers, most of whom are resellers.

Hayk asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) as he wants to have more animals on his farm; he plans to buy several bulls and animal fodder.

loans.use: to have more animals on his farm; he plans to buy several bulls and animal fodder

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 42 años de edad,  es una persona que  estudio hasta noveno grado y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos le ayudan. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias.


 Carmen se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 2 kilómetros para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para  producir mas leche para la venta y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Carmen planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche y  de la siembra, y del préstamo para la compra de las vacas podrá comprar en un futuro un terreno para pastar sus animales ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old, and left education after the ninth grade. She has a husband, who makes a living as a farmer with the help of their children. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. with her husband to begin her daily jobs.

Carmen works in agriculture, a trade she was taught by her husband. In the morning, they work on their plots of land, which are a 2km walk away. They spend the afternoons milking the cows to sell the milk. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy two dairy cows to produce more milk to sell and in this way increase their income.

Carmen plans to use her earnings from selling milk and growing crops, and from the loan to buy cows, to buy a plot of land for her animals to graze on in the future, as she currently only rents land.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in the city of Kapan, which is in the Syunik region. He is married and has a son and a daughter, both of whom are married and live separately with their families. Garik and his wife have been  engaged in the trading business for 17 years already. As Garik says, their business is divided into two parts: he sells vegetables, wheat, and different household goods, and his wife sells slippers and shoes for children, women, and men. He buys all of the products from the cities of Yerevan and Kapan once a month. Garik says that the business is profitable, but the income is seasonal since the place he rents is an open space. With the coming of spring and the warm summer months, it is easier to work. and Garik greatly hopes for a better income for his family.

Garik asks for this loan because he wants to refresh the assortment of goods in his stall and also wants to buy some new products for resale that will be in great demand with the coming of warm weather.

loans.use: to refresh the assortment of goods in his stall and buy some new products for resale that will be in great demand with the coming of warm weather

loans.name: Genevi

texts.en:
Genevi is 38 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase stocks of recycled materials for resale.

Genevi has previously taken out and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. She has been running her recycled materials business for 5 years and also earns income from a motorcycle transport business.

She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of recycled materials for resale

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesus de 59 años de edad  habita en el sur de Barranquilla con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos adultos. Para sostener su hogar desempeña la actividad de mantenimiento y reparación de enseres doméstico, actividad que aprendió hace 40 años,  cuando siendo  supervisor  de una empresa dedicada a ello, dejó de trabajar y decidió dedicarse a este servicio de manera independiente.
